itineraries.description:
This area is one of the remotest and most arid regions of Mongolia. You won’t likely meet any nomads, because the desert doesn’t offer enough to eat for their animals to survive. This itinerary crosses the “black desert” and reaches one of the most spectacular sites of the Gobi: Khermen Tsav.
If you've fueled up in Gurvantes, you'll need at least {->km 400} of range, as there is no fuel on this route until Shinejinst.
itineraries.highlights:
Getting lost in the maze of canyons in Khermen Tsav.
Pausing to photograph the colorful canyons of Nogoon Tsav (`i`tsav` meaning crack or fissure in Mongolian).
itineraries.name: Khermen Tsav – Shinejinst
itineraries.roadConditions:
The tracks are poorly marked and difficult to find because they are often cleared by water and wind, so you may have to navigate using landmarks and GPS waypoints. You can also easily get stuck in soft or sandy terrain if you leave the main tracks. 
Given all these risks, and the fact that the region sees very little traffic, you should only venture there in a group of several vehicles.

translatedDesc.fr: Vous traversez ici une des régions les plus arides et reculées de Mongolie, que les nomades ne fréquentent pas – en dehors des oasis – car ils ne peuvent pas y faire paître leurs troupeaux. Cet itinéraire vous emmène, à travers le « désert noir » sur deux sites exceptionnels, parmi les plus beaux et les plus sauvages du Gobi : les canyons aux splendides roches colorées de Khermen Tsav et de Nogoon Tsav.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Khermen Tsav, la fantastique "citadelle de roches" dans le désert.
Nogoon Tsav, très photogéniques avec ses roches balcnhe, rouges ouvertes  (`i`tsav` veut dire cassure ou fissure en mongol).

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
Cet itinéraire est relativement exposé, les pistes sont mal marquées, difficiles à trouver car souvent effacées par les eaux et le vent. 
En sortant des pistes, s’enliser dans des terrains mous ou sableux est fort possible. Etant donné l’isolement et la très faible fréquentation de la région, il est préférable de partir à plusieurs véhicules.

itineraries.description:
This brief detour offers a refreshing escape from the monotony of the main road. It descends from the plateau to the sea, leading to a stunning, secluded beach accessible only by a rough track suitable for vehicles with good ground clearance. Other vehicles, including big rigs, can park nearby and walk the final {->km 3} to the beach.
Be aware that the road back up is very steep and unpaved, but it should pose no issues as long as you drive with care.
itineraries.name: Minji

itineraries.description: This itinerary brings you to the Khangai mountains and leads to Mongolia's best-known and most beautiful waterfalls: the Orkhon Waterfalls.
itineraries.highlights:
The famous Orkhon Waterfalls.
The Orkhon valley's magnificent scenery;
Monumental tombs at the Temeen chuluu archaeological site.
The Buddhist temple of Tövkhön. 
An optional detour to a famous hot spring.
itineraries.name: Orkhon Waterfall
itineraries.roadConditions: The unpaved road is fine for the first part of the route (a new one is being built), but then becomes quite bad, even very bad as it climbs up the valley over the old lava flows. But it is accessible to all vehicles, provided it has good clearance.

translatedDesc.fr: Cet itinéraire vous emmène dans les montagnes des Khangaï et vous permet d’accéder aux plus connues et aux plus belles chutes d’eau de Mongolie : les chutes de l’Orkhon.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Les célèbres chutes de l'Orkhon.
Les paysages magnifiques de la vallée de l'Orkhon.
Les tombes monumentales du site archéologique de Temeen chuluu.
Le temple bouddhiste de Tövkhön. 
Un détour possible vers une célèbre source chaude.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: La piste est correcte sur la première partie du parcours mais devient ensuite assez mauvaise, voire très mauvaise en remontant la vallée lorsqu’elle passe sur les anciennes coulées de lave.

itineraries.description: This varied and magnificent itinerary allows one to cross the Terskey Ala Too mountain chain through a narrow pass in the middle of glaciers and scree, perhaps the best way to reach Lake Issyk Kul from the remote pastures in the middle of the country. You’ll overlook splendid gorges, you can bathe in hot springs, and share unforgettable times with nomads. Crossing the pass can be challenging in the beginning of the season and after rain, but on the other hand, you’ll be paid back with the exceptional countryside. The Tosor pass is the most beautiful route connecting Naryn to Lake Issyk Kul, but it is not suitable for normal cars, heavy bikes or big rigs. If you aren’t well prepared for rough roads, it is still enjoyable to only explore the first part of this itinerary (from Naryn to the Eki-Naryn gorge) then continue west along the end of [K11](::K11).
itineraries.highlights:
Tackle one of the most difficult pass of Kyrgyzstan, Tosor pass.
Enjoy the splendid Eki-Naryn gorge, with plenty of excellent camping spots.
itineraries.name: Tosor pass
itineraries.roadConditions: The track to the pass is steep, rough-going and quite eroded at the pass; a 4x4 or a well-equipped motorcycle will be necessary. On a bicycle, this is the easiest itinerary from south to north. The pass is snowy until the beginning of summer.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire magnifique et varié permet de franchir la chaine des Terskey Ala Too par un col étroit au milieu des glaciers et des éboulis, peut-être la meilleure manière de rejoindre le lac Issyk Kul depuis les pâturages isolés du centre du pays. Vous surplomberez des gorges splendides, vous pourrez vous baigner dans des sources chaudes et partager des moments inoubliables avec les nomades.
Le franchissement du col peut s'avérer délicat en début de saison et après de grosses pluies. Mais vous serez récompensés par des paysages exceptionnels.
Le col de Tosor est la plus belle route reliant Naryn au lac Issyk Kul, mais elle n'est pas accessible à tous les véhicules. Si vous avez un camping car ou un camion, il est toujours possible de n'explorer que la première partie de cet itinéraire (de Naryn à la gorge d'Eki-Naryn), qui est facile, puis de revenir en arrière, voir de continuer vers l'ouest par la fin de l'[itinéraire K11](::K11), mais la piste est moins bonne.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Un des cols les plus difficiles du Kirghizstan, le Tosor.
Les splendides gorges d'Eki-Naryn, où l'on trouve de très beaux coins de bivouac.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Piste raide, cassante et ravinée au niveau du col. Nécessite un 4x4 ou une moto bien équipée. À vélo, itinéraire plus facile dans le sens sud-nord. Col enneigé jusqu'au début de l'été.

itineraries.name: Nurbu La offroad
itineraries.highlights:
Magnificent views on the Hanle valley.
A little-used offroad route.
itineraries.description:
This is the most difficult of the different routes to reach Umling La from Hanle. It is entirely offroad, using sandy tracks that are not too difficult but require a capable vehicle. It is also the shortest and most direct.
If you're not so confident, you can opt instead of taking the slightly longer but still unpaved [Ukdungle road](::L29) or the entirely paved [Photi La road](::L13).
itineraries.roadConditions: A good sandy track and a few tight switch backs which are not that difficult. Campers and heavey vehicles should avoid it, though.

itineraries.description: This route links two major tourist destinations: Nubra valley and Pangong Tso. From Hundar or Sumur, you would first take the excellent road to Agham, then this route, with its tricky off-road sections, and finally the last part of the [Chang La road](::L10) to reach Pangong Tso (total {->km 170} from Hundar to Spangmik).
itineraries.highlights:
A great way to link Nubra with Pangong.
One of the last challenging route of Ladakh.
itineraries.roadConditions: There are several off-rodd stretches that involve sometimes tricky water crossings, depending on the weather conditions. This route has been closed for the latter part of 2025 due to some parts of the road having been destroyed by heavy rains.
itineraries.name: Agham - Durbuk

itineraries.description:
This variation of the Shakhdara Valley route takes you to a beautiful high-altitude lake on a small, rarely used double-track. During the summer months, shepherds live there in small huts and yurts, but there is no permanent village.
This is a very isolated area, even more so than the Shakhdara valley road, so you should not travel there alone, or at the very least carry food, water and a tent.
This route should only be attempted during the summer months; otherwise, you risk being snowed in.
itineraries.highlights:
The mesmerizing color fo this high altitude lake.
Meet the herders who camp here during the summer.
itineraries.name: Turumtai Kul
itineraries.roadConditions:
The tracks is rough but doable until step 4, then the track disappears and you'll drive offroad until the lake. After that it's OK until the Maisara pass.
High-clearance vehicles and light motorbikes will be fine, but big rigs and campers, which can make it just fine from Khorog to Javshangoz, will have to stay on the [Shakhdara road](::P3) and turn back to Khorog.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cette variante de l’itinéraire de la vallée de la Shakhdara vous mène à un magnifique lac d’altitude, accessible par une petite piste très peu fréquentée. Pendant les mois d’été, des bergers y habitent dans de petites cabanes et des yourtes, mais il n’y a pas de vrai village.
Cette piste est très isolée, encore plus que la route principale de la vallée de la Shakhdara. Il est donc déconseillé de s’y rendre seul, ou alors il faut impérativement emporter de la nourriture, de l’eau et une tente.
Il faudra attendre le début de l'été pour que la piste soit dégagée de la neige, et encore, une tempête peut survenir à tout moment.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Le souvenir inoubliable d'un bivouac au bord du lac Turumtaï.
La rencontre avec les bergers, qui ne voient d'habitude jamais aucun touriste.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
La piste est mauvaise mais passable jusqu'au point 4, ensuite la piste disparait entre les 2 lacs, on roule hosrs-piste. Puis on retrouve une bonne piste jusqu'au col de Maisara.
Il vous faudra une bonne garde au sol, ou une moto légère, mais un 4x4 n'est pas strictement nécessaire par temps sec. Les véhicules lourds, qui peuvent arriver jusqu'à Javshangoz depuis Khorog, devront rester sur la [piste principale](::P3) et faire demi-tour.

itineraries.name: Marsimik La
itineraries.roadConditions: A good paved road now reaches the top of Marsimik La, so there's no issue with any vehicle.
itineraries.highlights:
Reaching Marsimik La, and soon hopefully beyond.
Gorgeous Sko valley.
itineraries.description:
Marsimik La ({^5580}), once considered one of the highest motorable passes in the world, has lost some of its fame since Umling La claimed that title. Still, it remains a stunning half-day excursion—well worth it if you have an extra day to spare while staying at Pangong (and you should).
Historically, Marsimik La was part of a caravan route used for trade between India and Nepal via the gentle [Kongka La](Kongka La). However, with China’s takeover of Tibet and the deterioration of India–China relations, this route has become a geopolitical dead-end.
Tourists are allowed to travel as far as the top of Marsimik La, but access beyond—into the Chang Chenmo Valley, including the [Kyam hot springs](Kyam hot springs)—is prohibited. This area was the site of a fatal skirmish between Indian and Chinese forces in 1959.
Thankfully, the nearby Sko Valley has been opened to both Indian and foreign tourists. It’s a fantastic area for trekking, famous for the “6 Holy Lakes,” a series of high-altitude alpine lakes, all above {^5000}. If you're traveling by dirt bike or 4x4, you can go as far as the [first camp](Sko valley camp), making it a rewarding detour from the main road—especially since Marsimik La itself is a one-way route that leads nowhere beyond the summit.

itineraries.roadConditions: Excellent tarmac, no issue. Of course, at these altitudes, a spell of bad weather means probable snow on top of the passes.
itineraries.description:
This is the easiest of the routes from Hanle to Umling La, because it's all black top. But it's also the longest. Regarding fuel range, as the closest fuel station is in Nyoma, you'll need to account for at least {->km 320}, unless you buy a jerrycan in Hanle to top up.
The road is good but twisty and not very fast, so it will take most of the day for the round-trip. You can also combine this route with the more difficult unpaved road via [Ukdungle](::L29) to make a loop.
Note that, until further notice, foreigners are not authorized to get to Umling La, unless the permit that you got in Leh specifically allows it.
itineraries.name: Hanle - Umling La
itineraries.highlights:
The highest pass in the world.
Pothi La, for the lovers of switchbacks.

itineraries.description: This route is extremely important for Kyrgyzstan because it gives direct access to China via the Torugart mountain pass. This is the main route for lorries laden with commercial goods. To visit China, it is possible to pass through Torugart, though the formalities to do so are much more complicated than passing through Irkeshtam. While the route is not the most exciting, one can see several interesting sites along the way.
itineraries.highlights:
The Tash Rabat caravanserai, hidden amongst snowy peaks.
Make a detour to famous Lake Song Kul.
The magnificent Lake Chatyr Kul.
itineraries.name: Balykchy - Torugart
itineraries.roadConditions: This route, which was an important axis on the Silk Road, is entirely paved and open the whole year.

translatedDesc.fr: Cette route est extrêmement importante pour le Kirghizstan car elle donne un accès direct à la Chine par le col de Torugart. C'est par là que transitent tous les camions de marchandises. Pour aller en Chine, Torugart est un point de passage possible bien que les formalités soient plus compliquées qu'à Irkeshtam. La route n'est pas la plus excitante, mais elle donne accès à des sites intéressants comme Tash Rabat, Song Kul et le lac Chatyr Kul.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Accéder au fameux lac de Song Kul par deux itinéraires différents.
Le célèbre caravansérail de Tash Rabat niché sous de hauts sommets enneigés.
Enchaîner avec le [lac Kel Suu](::K9) ou le [col de MELS](::K19).

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Le goudron est en bon état et le ravitaillement ne pose pas de problème jusqu'à At Bashi.

itineraries.titlePhotoCaption: Switchback to climb to Thit Zarbo la, from Nyoma side.
itineraries.name: Nidar - Chilling - Ryul
itineraries.highlights:
A little-used route that can be used as an alternative between Mahe and Hanle.
Bird watching around 2 high-altitude lakes.
itineraries.description: This short route connects the main [Upshi - Nyoma road](::L12) with the [Hanle - Tso Moriri road](::L27). It used to be a rather difficult off-road itinerary, until they started to pave the road. As of 2025, it is built until Thit Zarbo La (also known as Nidar La), and no doubt that the connection with the Hanle road will be soon paved as well.
itineraries.roadConditions:
As of 2025, the road is paved until the base of Thit Zarbo La, and the climb to the pass has been widened and improved.
The stretch between the pass and the Chilling and Ryul lakes is still off-road and very sandy.
Paved all the way, no problem for any vehicle.
itineraries.description:
The Sham valley is well-known to the trekkers, because the so-called "baby trek" crosses it. It's a short hike popular for its easy logistics and because its relatively low altitude is great for acclimatization. This is also true if you're riding a bike or driving: it's safer to take a day or two and make this trip, rather than getting straight to Pangong Tso just after you land in Leh, which can be dangerous.
The road is all paved and easy. That's also a great detour from the [main highway](::L2) if you're traveling from Leh to Lamayuru.
If you're short of time, you can rejoin the [main highway](::L2) from Hemis Shukpachan instead of crossing the newly-paved [Meptek La](Meptek La) and end the loop [via Temisgam](::L35).
No permit is needed for this route.
itineraries.highlights:
Likir monastery.
Gorgeous villages.
Twisty roads.
Fantastic view from a little used pass.
itineraries.name: Sham Valley

itineraries.description:
The Murdash valley is a hidden gem often overlooked by the tourists. It's located close to Osh, and is well known to the locals who come here during the hotter months to camp and picnic in the cool and green meadows.
It can be a great detour on the [Osh - Sary Tash road](::K13), but it can also make a great loop from Osh by returning via the Jiptyk valley.
itineraries.highlights:
The lush scenery and cool weather.
An off the beaten path itinerary with few tourists.
Great gravel roads.
itineraries.name: Murdash - Jiptik
itineraries.roadConditions: The road are unpaved but not difficult, although you'll need a trail bike or a sturdy vehicle with high clearance. Campers and big rigs can get well into the Murdash valley and back before crossing the pass.

translatedDesc.fr: Située à proximité d'Osh, la vallée de Murdash est bien connue des locaux qui viennent ici pendant les mois les plus chauds pour camper et pique-niquer dans les prairies fraîches et verdoyantes. Elle est par contre peu fréquentée par les touristes, contrairement à la région de Song Kul par exemple. On peut y venir pour faire un break sur la route [Osh - Sary Tash](::K13) et y camper, mais on peut aussi faire une magnifique boucle depuis Osh en passant un col et en redescendant par la vallée de Jiptik.

translatedHighlights.fr:
La beauté des pâturages et la fraîcheur en été.
Un itinéraire hors des sentiers battus.
Des magnifiques pistes pour les amateurs.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
C'est un itinéraire entièrement offroad entre l'intersection de la route principale (début de l'itinéraire) et l'intersection de Papan.
Les campers et les camions sont les bienvenus dans la vallée de Murdash, mais pour aller plus loin et passer le col il vaut mieux avoir un 4x4 ou un trail.

itineraries.description:
The road connecting Muscat and Salalah along the ocean is relatively recent. 20 years ago, the only paved route linking these two cities was the inland road that cuts through the desert. The coastal route, extending from Muscat and Sur to Salalah, is far more scenic, although the northern section of this route, approximately 400 km, features fairly uneventful, featureless landscapes. However, picturesque beaches dot the area, providing pleasant breaks from the road. As you continue south, the terrain becomes more rugged and visually interesting.
The coastal road is fully paved and very straightforward to navigate. Fuel stations are conveniently spaced every 50 to 100 km, ensuring smooth travel with minimal logistical concerns.
itineraries.name: Coastal road

translatedDesc.fr:
La route reliant Muscat à Salalah le long de la mer est relativement récente; il y a 20 ans, la seule route goudronnée reliant les deux villes principales d'Oman passait par le désert. La route côtière, de Sur à Salalah en passant par Duqm est beaucoup plus intéressante et variée que la 2x2 pistes qui traverse le désert. Certes, les pemiers 400 km depuis Mahut et jusqu'aux premiers reliefs de Minji présentent un paysage très monotonne, bordé par de belles plages certes, mais sans relief. La partie sud par contre est absolument magnifique, avec des montagnes, des falaises et des wadis.
La route côtière est entièrement goudronnée, et seuls les détours proposés peuvent parfois être un peu compliqués. Les stations-service sont espacées de 50 à 150 km, et elles sont en général accompagnées de magasins et restaurants, donc le ravitaillement ne pose pas de problème particulier.

itineraries.description:
You can follow this itinerary from start to finish, or choose to explore only certain sections, especially if you prefer to avoid challenging roads. It begins with an easy route that provides access to the stunning Juuku Valley, famous for its hot springs and numerous trekking trails. From there, the terrain becomes much more difficult, suitable only for experienced off-roaders, until it reaches the Kumtor mine plateau. After crossing the Barskoon-Aksay road, the route takes on the equally demanding but rewarding Arabel Pass, which leads to the Kochkor-Naryn main road. It eventually climbs to Song Kul via the Kalmak Ashuu Pass.
If you start this route from the [Barskoon road](:::4), then the end of the route is rated "difficult".
Note that there is no fuel available on the entire itinerary. You can detour to Kochkor or Naryn, or continue down the Moldo Ashuu pass to Ak-Tal, which adds another {->km 100} or so.
The itinerary is best done over 2 or 3 days, camping in Juuku valley and/or in the Burkhan valley.
itineraries.highlights:
The hots springs in Juuku.
A challenging ride across the Juuku pass for hard-core offroaders.
The beautiful Burkhan valley.
Arrive at the famous Song Kul.
itineraries.name: Jukuu - Arabel
itineraries.roadConditions: The road until Juuku is good, then it's becomes more suitable to bicycles and enduro bikes. Across the Arabel pass the road is rough but ok with a high-clearance vehicle. If it's been raining, then 4WD is mandatory.

translatedDesc.fr:
Vous partez ici sur une route chargée d’histoire au cœur des montagnes des Tian Shan. Vous traverserez des paysages de hautes montagnes époustouflants sur les traces des marchands qui reliaient le lac Issyk Kul à la Chine du temps de la Route de la Soie. C’est aussi là que passa Ella Maillart lors de son exploration des Tian Shan en 1932 et Sylvain Tesson dans sa Chevauchée des steppes en 1999.
Vous pouvez suivre cet itinéraire de bout en bout, ou alors décider de n'explorer que certains segments, surtout si vous préférez éviter les parties les plus difficiles. On commence par une bonne piste jusqu'au sources chaudes de Juuku, puis cela devient beaucoup plus difficile jusqu'au plateau de Kumtor, à réserver aux cyclistes et aux enduristes aguerris. La deuxième partie le long de la vallée de la Burkhan est difficile mais tout à fait faisable si vous disposez d'une bonne garde au sol. Un 4x4 sera nécessaire s'il a récemment plu.
Notez qu'il n'y a pas de carburant le long de ce parcours, ni à son arrivée à Song Kul. Vous pouvez donc faire un détour par [Kochkor](Kochkor Fuel) ou Naryn pour faire le plein (env. 300 km total), ou alors pousser jusqu'à [Ak-Tal](Ak-Tal fuel) en bas du col de Moldo Ashuu, ce qui rajoute environ 100 km pour une autonomie totale de plus de 500 km.
Prévoyez idéalement 2-3 jours pour l'itinéraire complet.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Les sources chaude de Juuku.
Le challenge de passer le col de Juuku.
Camper dans la très belle vallée de Burkhan.
Finir au lac Song Kul.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Piste difficile dans la vallée de la Burkhan et très difficile vers le col de Juuku. 4x4 indispensables pour explorer les Tian Shan au-delà de cet itinéraire. Pas de ravitaillement en route sauf chez les nomades.

itineraries.description: This route offers a nice tour of the Altai Mountains around Olgii. You will pass through small, isolated villages, camp near Lake Tolbo, one of the most beautiful lakes in the country, marvel at the 4000-m snow-capped summits and follow beautiful rivers. During holidays you may be able to see typical Mongol games, and at any time of year you will likely be approached by roadside eagle-hunters offering a photograph with their captive animal.
itineraries.highlights:
See typical Mongol games during the holiday.
Visit Mongols of kazakh ancestry.
itineraries.name: Around Lake Tolbo
itineraries.roadConditions: The well-worn tracks are in rather good condition and the steppe is filled with yurt camps.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire vous offre de réaliser un joli tour dans les montagnes de l’Altaï autour d’Olgii. Vous pourrez visiter des petits villages à l’ambiance de bout du monde, bivouaquer au bord du lac Tolbo, un des plus beaux lacs du pays, admirer les cimes enneigées des sommets à plus de 4000 m, et longer de très belles rivières.
Les pistes sont assez bonnes et assez fréquentées. Les campements de yourtes sont nombreux. Ici les Mongols sont en grande majorité d’origine kazakhe, vous pourrez découvrir leurs coutumes et leurs jeux si vous arrivez au moment d’une fête. Vous serez probablement abordés par les dresseurs d’aigles au bord de la route.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Découvrir la culture des Mongols d'ethnie kazakh.
Apprendre comment se déroule la célèbre chasse à l'aigle, si vous y êtes durant le festival (septembre).

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Bonnes pistes dans l'ensemble, plusieurs gués peu profonds à traverser.

itineraries.highlights:
Ryul and Chilling Tso, gorgeous high-altitude lakes.
Meet the kiangs, the wild asses of the Tibetan plateau.
A direct link between two of the most popular places in Ladakh.
itineraries.titlePhotoCaption: Track from Hanle to Ryul Tso, before it was paved.
itineraries.roadConditions: The road is entirely paved and excellent.
itineraries.description:
This route used to be the greatest off-road itinerary in Ladakh. It is still a fantastic trip, but from 2025, the road has been paved all the way from Hanle to Chumur and to Tso Moriri, so it isn't as adventurous as it used to be. Still, when you reach the south end of Tso Moriri, there's a shortcut to reach the Tsomoriri - Spiti road which is entirely offroad.
Note to foreigners : the permit that you get in Leh doesn't mention Chumur, but as the road doesn't get to the village itself, and there is no checkpoint, one can legitimely assume that this route is allowed to all, provided you have a permit mentionning Hanle and Karzok.
itineraries.name: Hanle - Tsomoriri

itineraries.description:
This short drive takes you to Musandam most famous beach, over a steep but good track.
The good paved road which currently ends at the park of Al-Khalidiah, popular for picnics and camping, which is separated form the sea by a steep mountain. A project has been started to build a new road linking Limah over a very difficult terrain next to the sea, which will cut short the trip to Limah, and onward to Dibba.
itineraries.name: Khor Najd

translatedDesc.fr:
Cette petite excursion vous amène vers la plage la plus connue de Musandam, grâce à une bonne piste très raide.
La bonne route goudronnée qui se termine actuellement à Al-Khalidiah, près d'un parc très fréquenté par les locaux, qui est séparé de la mer par une petite montagne. Les autorités ont décidé l'extension de cette route en direction de Limah et Dibba, en passant par la côte très escarpée. Cette nouvelle route raccourcira notablement les temps de parcours entre Khasab, Dibba et par extension le reste d'Oman.

itineraries.description:
The valley through which the Panj River flows between Ishkashim and Langar is known as the Wakhan. It takes its name from the Wakhan region, which includes the Wakhan Corridor in Afghanistan. It is an essential route through the Pamir mountains. It is said to have been used by Marco Polo on his journey to China, which he called Vocam. 
From the junction with the M41, the road crosses the Khargush Pass and then follows the Pamir River to Langar, where it enters the Wakhan Valley. The Pamir then joins the Wakhan to form the Panj, which flows towards Ishkashim and then Khorog. You pass from arid and isolated plateaus to a green and fertile valley, magnificently carved out beneath high snow-capped peaks. Before reaching the high plateaux, you should stock up on fuel and food in the villages of the Wakhan. There are plenty of guesthouses to choose from, but good camping spots are rare as every flat piece of land is farmed. The route is also particularly attractive due to the many archaeological remains (rock engravings, ruined fortresses) and the spectacular views of the Hindu Kush mountains. And you'll certainly remember the warm welcome from locals.
itineraries.highlights:
The amazing views on the Hindu Kush.
Garm Chashma and Bibi Fatima hot springs.
Yamchun fortress and the view from up there.
The petroglyphs at Langar.
itineraries.name: Wakhan
itineraries.roadConditions:
The first part of the route up to Langar is generally in good condition and easy for all vehicles.
However, the road deteriorates significantly on the climb to Khargush Pass. Expect heavy washboarding, some loose sandy sections, and a water crossing that can be challenging at times.
Fuel is not an issue within the Wakhan itself, but after Vrang, your next refueling options are either [Alichur](::P1:15), 200 km away toward Murghab, or 250 km if you backtrack to Khorog via the M41.
itineraries.titlePhotoCaption: Amazing view on the Hindu Kush from the Wakhan valley.

translatedDesc.fr:
La Wakhan figure tout en haut dans la liste des endroits à ne pas manquer au Pamir. La route suit le cours de la Panj sur une voie de circulation majeure empruntée par les aventuriers, pélerins et commerçants depuis l'âge d'or de la Route de la Soie, bien avant que les Occidentaux ne décident de placer une frontière le long de cette rivière, séparant ainsi en Tadjiks et Afghans ceux qui sont avant tout des Wakhis.
La vallée traversée par la rivière Panj entre Ishkashim et Langar est connue sous le nom de Wakhan. Elle tire son nom de la rivière Wakhan, un affluent de la Panj qui coule dans le "corridor de Wakhan" en Afghanistan. C'est une voie de passage majeure à travers les montagnes du Pamir. Elle aurait été empruntée par Marco Polo lors de son voyage vers la Chine, qu'il nomme Vocam. Vous passerez d'une vallée verdoyante et fertile, magnifiquement encaissée en contrebas de hauts sommets enneigés, à des hauts plateaux arides et isolés. Vous aurez le choix entre de nombreuses guesthouses, par contre les coins de bivouacs sauvages sont rares car la moindre parcelle plate est consacrée à l'agriculture. Les nombreux vestiges archéologiques (gravures rupestres, forteresses en ruine) et les points de vue très spectaculaires sur les montagnes de l’Hindu Kush ajoutent encore à l'intérêt de cet itinéraire.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Le panorama spectaculaire sur le Hindu Kush.
Les sources chaudes de Bibi Fatima et de Garm Chashma.
La forteresse de Yamchun et la vue depuis là-haut sur la vallée.
Les pétroglyphes de Langar.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
Bonne route le long de la Panj (goudron fréquent) et jusqu'à [Langar](:::8), sans problème quel que soit votre véhicule.
Ensuite la route se dégrade fortement dans la montée du col de Khargush. Beaucoup de tôle ondulée assez pénible, un peu de sable mou et une traversée de torrent à gué qui peut se révéler difficile. Donc les camions et camping-cars devraient renoncer à cette partie de l'itinéraire et revenir à Khorog.

translatedTitleCaption.fr: Incroyables panoramas sur la chaîne de l'Hindu Kush depuis la vallé de la Wakhan.

itineraries.highlights:
The spectacular sights of Nun and Kun peaks and the Drang-Drung glacier.
The transition from the Muslim to the Buddhist culture.
The very green Suru valley with spectacular views on the highest peaks.
itineraries.roadConditions:
The road between Kargil and Padum is almost entirely paved, and in good condition. The average speed is higher between Parkachik and Abran than in the Suru valley or near Padum, where the crossing of villages is often in bad shape.
Pensi La is normally kept open all year-round, but snowfalls that cut off the road can be expected from November until at least April.
itineraries.description:
The Kargil-Padum road used to be the only way to access Zanskar, before the new [direct road](::L5) to Leh was built. But since that road is frequently cut off by landslides and sometimes flooding, the Kargil-Padum road remains a vital link between Zanskar and the rest of Ladakh. If you're coming from Srinagar, there's an optional "short cut" between Drass and Sankoo that bypasses Kargil through [Umba La](::L34).
This is a long road, although it has been recently upgraded and Panikhar or Parkachik are good places to break the trip. You can also overnight in Rangdum.
With the new paved road it's now easy to reach Padum from Kargil in a short day (or vice-versa).
itineraries.name: Kargil - Padum

itineraries.description: This short detour brings you to a nice viewpoint with 360 degrees view over the sea.
itineraries.name: Jebel Fitt

translatedDesc.fr: Ce petit détour vous amène à une falaise avec une très belle vue à 180 degrés sur la mer.

itineraries.description:
Musandam is an exclave of Oman, separated from the rest of the country by the UAE. It lies at the tip of a peninsula facing Iran and the Strait of Hormuz. This mountainous region is connected to the west by a well-paved coastal road leading to Ras al Khaimah (RAK) in the UAE. However, the road from Khasab, the capital, to Dibba in the UAE on the East coast is a (rather good) gravel track that crosses several mountains. In addition, the border at Dibba is only open to Omani and Emirati citizens. 
The primary ways to access Musandam are via the western coastal road from the UAE or by ferry from Shinas in Oman to Khasab or Limah. Most visitors come here and take a cruise in the stunning fjords at the peninsula's northern tip, which is the region's main tourist attraction. Many also fly into Khasab from Muscat, as the city has its own airport.
For those hesitant about driving on gravel, a round trip from RAK in the UAE is an option. However, this route focuses on exploring the interior of the peninsula and ends with the ferry at Limah to avoid backtracking. Locals, in contrast, can drive to Dibba and cross into the UAE to reconnect with Oman.
The road from RAK to Khasab is paved and in excellent condition, while the gravel road from Khasab to Limah is generally well-maintained and suitable for all vehicles, including big rigs, though it has some steep sections. There are numerous great camping spots along the way, but all essential facilities, such as hotels, fuel, and supermarkets, are concentrated in Khasab.
As of 2024, ferry tickets unfortunately cannot be booked online in advance. Passengers must purchase tickets in person at the ports in Khasab, Limah, or Shinas, with the risk that the next available ferry may already be fully booked.
itineraries.name: Musandam

translatedDesc.fr:
Musandam est un exclave d'Oman, séparé du reste du pays par les Émirats. Il occupe la pointe nord de la péninsule arabique, en face du détroit d'Hormuz qui le sépare de l'Iran. Cette région montagneuse est connectée à l'ouest par une bonne route goudronnée qui suit la côte depuis Ras al Khaimah aux Émirats. L'autre route, reliant Khasab, la capitale, à Dibba aux Émirats, est une piste de montagne raide et poussiéreuse. De plus, la frontière à Dibba n'est ouverte qu'aux Omanais et aux Émiratis. Le principal accès à Musandam se fait donc soit par la route par la côte nord-ouest, soit par la mer sur le ferry qui relie Shinas (Oman) à Khasab ou Limah.
La plupart des visiteurs se rendent à Khasab, à 3h de route de Dubaï, pour faire une croisière dans les fjords sur un boutre traditionnel, ce qui est l'attraction majeure de la région. Certains y accèdent également par les airs depuis Muscat. Il est donc possible de faire un aller-retour rapide depuis les Émirats par une bonne route, mais il serait dommage de ne pas visiter l'intérieur du pays. Cet itinéraire vous emmène donc sur les routes de montagne pour explorer les coins reculés de la péninsule, en évitant de revenir sur ses pas en finissant par le ferry de Limah à Shinas. Les locaux, par contre, pourront rejoindre Dibba par la route, et, qui sait, peut-être que dans l'avenir les touristes étrangers pourront aussi le faire, surtout après la construction de la nouvelle route reliant Khasabà Dibba par la côte;
La route goudronnée de RAK à Khasab est excellente, et la piste de Khasab à Limah est bonne également mais pentue et poussiéreuse. Elle est pourtant accessible à tous les véhicules, même les camions. Vous trouverez de nombreux coins de bivouac magnifiques, mais par contre aucun magasin ni hôtel. Khasab est le seul endroit où vous trouverez restaurants, hôtels et stations service.
Jusqu'à présent (2024), il est impossible de réserver le ferry par internet, il faut se rendre en personne au port de Khasab, Limah ou Shinas, au risque de voir le prochain ferry déjà plein.

itineraries.roadConditions: The track is mostly straight, gently climbing through a wide valley, then it dips down a canyon until it reaches the paved road. Suitable for any offroad vehicle, SUVs and motorbikes alike.
itineraries.titlePhotoCaption: Good gravel road from Hanle to Ukdungle.
itineraries.description: This route has gained popularity in the last few years, and nowadays tour operators routinely bring their customers to Umling La this way (riders, mostly). It's off-road all the way to the Nurbula Top - Zursur road, but it's not very difficult. What's more, the landscapes are jaw-dropping. But if you're driving a normal car, or a heavy camper, you should stick to the [Photi La](::L13) paved road.
itineraries.name: Hanle - Ukdungle - Chisumle
itineraries.highlights:
An excellent unpaved road through breathtaking landscapes.
Shorter alternative to the rather long Photi La road.

itineraries.name: Chiktan back roads
itineraries.roadConditions:
There are a few km of paved road around Chitkan, but 90% of the itinerary is on mostly easy dirt roads. Only Sashi La is a little more difficult. The alternative via Kaldang Kildang La is a narrow but good gravel road.
So this route is suitable for most sturdy vehicles, but normal cars and campers (and big rigs) should avoid it.
itineraries.description:
To get to the start point of this route, first take the [Dha - Hanu road](::L9), along the Indus, also known as the Aryan valley, go visit the Brokpa villages, then return a few km on the same road and cross a bridge to reach the mountains betxeen the Indus and the [Kargil - Leh highway](::L2). This little visited area will take you from surprise to surprise, from charming villages with terraced fields to magnificent rugged passes, to another isolated valley. It's a beautiful itinerary not far from Leh, and there are several shortcuts to return to the Kargil - Leh highway.
If you're doing this as a day trip from Leh then it will be a very long day. It is better to start from Lamayuru. But there are many possible ways to shorten, or lengthen this trip. 
There is no fuel at all in this area. If you've last fueled in Khaltse and you're doing a loop, returning on [via Batalik](::L9), you'll need a range of {->km 250}. If instead you're headed to Kargil from Lalung, then you'll need {->km 150}.
itineraries.highlights:
The specific culture of the Brokpa people.
Picturesque, rarely used roads.
An excellent alternative to the main Srinagar-Leh highway.

itineraries.description:
The Kara-Kamysh valley is a great alternative to the nearby Sary-Chelek park, as it is less crowded but just as interesting.
Access is not difficult although the bigger rigs may be put off by the narrow double-track leading to it. The large grassy area by the lake is perefect for camping.
There is no entrance fee to the area.
itineraries.highlights:
Lake Kara-Kamysh, a fantastic place to camp.
Organise treks on foot or on horseback to nearby Sary-Chelek.
itineraries.name: Kara-Kamysh
itineraries.roadConditions: The road is paved for the first half, then you'll drive on a narrow double-track that will be too tricky for campers or big rigs. You'll need a high-clerance vehicle.

translatedDesc.fr:
La vallée de Kara-Kamysh est une excellente alternative au parc voisin de Sary-Chelek, car elle est moins fréquentée mais tout aussi intéressante.
L'accès n'est pas difficile, sauf pour les camions qui auront de la peine à passer par l'étroite et fragile piste qui y mène. Le grand chanp en herbe au bord du lac est parfait pour le camping.
L'entrée est gratuite.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Le lac Kara-Kamysh, un superbe lieu de camping.
Organiser un trek à pied ou à cheval vers Sary-Chelek.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: La route est goudronnée sur la première moitié du parcours, ensuite il faudra prendre une petite piste étroite qui n'est pas faire pour les camions et les camping-cars, mais sans problème avec un bon 4x4;

itineraries.name: Tso Moriri south offroad
itineraries.description: For the more adventurous of us, always on the lookout for more off-road itineraries, here's a short but welcome route which can be combined with the road from Hanle across [Salsal La](::L27) to arrive in Karzok from the south. It's obviously more difficult than the paved road running around the north of the lake, so only attempt this if you have good off-roading skills.
itineraries.roadConditions: The track across Norbu La is rarely used so it could worsen considerably after the rains. But it normal conditions, it only requires a light motorbike or a capable 4x4 and good skills.
itineraries.highlights: A rarely used offroad shortcut allowing a complete loop around Tso Moriri.

itineraries.description:
Masirah is a stunning island that’s easily accessible via a short ferry ride. If you’re drawn to desert-like landscapes, vast white-sand beaches, turquoise waters, and intriguing shipwrecks, you’ll fall in love with this island.
The east coast, which faces the ocean, boasts diverse scenery and superb beaches perfect for swimming and snorkeling. In contrast, the west coast, facing the mainland, features more monotonous landscapes and less inviting beaches for swimming (however it’s a paradise for kite surfers). Note that there are often quite a bit of trash on the beaches, as often in Oman.
Masirah is well-known for its thriving fishing industry. Along its beaches, you’ll often see fishermen, especially in the evening when they return from the sea. If you meet them at dusk, you might be able to buy fresh fish or even lobster (crawfish) straight from their catch.
Camping spots abound on the island, so it’d be futile to list them all. That said, we’ll mention a few favorites.
Masirah has just one main road that circles the island, along with a second paved road that crosses it at the midpoint. These roads are all well-maintained and suitable for any type of vehicle. To add some adventure, we suggest two off-road detours that take you away from the main route. Be cautious, however, when driving to the beaches—loose sand can easily trap a vehicle.
Traffic on the island is minimal, except perhaps in Hilf, the main town. Even if you choose to camp near the road, it will likely be quiet at night.
You can explore the island’s itinerary in either direction; there’s no preferred route.
itineraries.name: Masirah

translatedDesc.fr:
Masirah est une île superbe pour qui aime les paysages désertiques, les eaux turquoises, les immenses plages de sable blanc... et les épaves de bateau !
La côte est (côté océan indien) possède des paysages varies avec des plages de sable blanc immenses, des criques entourées de rochers noirs propices à la baignade et au snorkeling, une eau turquoise, des coquillages magnifiques.
La côte ouest possède un relief moins accidenté, une côte plus vaseuse. Elle est plus favorable au kitesurf mais moins esthétique.  Notez que les plages sont souvent encombrées de déchets, quoique peut-être un peu moins qu'ailleurs à Oman.
L'île est désertique, la seule ville est Hilf, où l'on arrive avec le ferry. Vous ne trouverez aucun point de ravitaillement en dehors de la ville, hormis un restaurant au campement des kite surfeurs. Mais vous pourrez toujours acheter du poisson à un pêcheur n'importe où sur la côte. Ils sont plus nombreux dans la partie sud et ouest de l'île.
En saison (printemps - été), vous pourrez avec un peu de chance observer des tortues qui viennent pondre sur la plage. Dans les rochers vous verrez de magnifiques poissons, des oursins, des étoiles de mer et des coraux en tout genre. L'été est propice au kitesurf sur la côte est. 
Masirah est connue pour ses fonds poissonneux, d'ailleurs vous verrez souvent des bâteaux de pêcheurs sur les plages. Masirah est aussi célèbre pour ses ses boutres, les bateaux traditionnels en bois avec des voiles en trapèze, originaires de l'océan indien. Évidemment aujourd'hui ces bateaux naviguent uniquement au moteur. Vous pourrez aussi observer des navires échoués tout le long des côtes. 
Masirah a été occupée depuis le néolithique au moins. Les populations anciennes ont laissé des traces discrètes comme des amas de coquillage. Depuis plus de 4 millénaires le minerais de cuivre est exploité, et on a retrouvé des objets en cuivre de Masirah jusqu'en Mésopotamie. 
La route qui fait le tour de l'île est en très bon état, et entièrement goudronnée. Un 4x4 n'est nécessaire que pour aller camper sur les plages où le sable est souvent profond.
Les horaires du ferry sont variables en fonction de la météo. Malheureusement il est toujours impossible de réserver par internet, il faut se rendre au port pour acheter son billet, comptez 17 OMR pour une voiture et deux personnes (aller simple).

itineraries.description:
This route follows the primary north to south road in Kyrgyzstan, the M41, which connects Bishkek and Osh before continuing to either Tajikistan or Uzbekistan. It crosses high mountain passes exceeding 3000 metres, follows the splendid turquoise waters of the Toktogul reservoir, stops at Osh, an old city on the Silk Road, and continues into the Fergana plain until the Tajik border. It gives access to thrilling excursions to mountain lakes and 
Before leaving the capital, you may be tempted by a mountain hike. Don't expect to be alone, as you're very close to the capital here, and these valleys are quite popular: Ala Archa, Alamedin or Issyk Ata.
itineraries.highlights:
The famous [Ala Archa valley](Ala Archa), a beautiful starting point for hikes leading to the foot of glaciers (entrance fee required).
The Alamedin valley, which is relatively less crowded, and its hot springs operated in a [sanatorium](Sanatorium Alamedin) of the purest Soviet style.
The [Issyk Ata valley](Issyk Ata), where you'll also find hot water pools, which are quite popular with locals.
Access to Lake Song Kul via routes [K5](::K5), [K6](::K6), and [K7](::K7).
Osh, the center of the kirgiz Ferghana valley, and stepping stone to the [Pamir Highway](:Tajikistan:P1).
Detour to the famous walnut forest of [Arslanbob](Arslanbob), and the picturesque [Lake Kara Suu](Kara Suu).
itineraries.name: Bishkek - Osh
itineraries.roadConditions: The road is open all year round. It is fully paved and presents no difficulties except occasionally on the Töö-Ashuu and Alabel passes where snow falls can occur any time of year. The biggest dangers are the numerous speed traps manned by corrupt cops, traffic, and the poor tarmac on the hairpin bends of the mountain passes.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire emprunte la route principale de communication entre le nord et le sud du pays, la M41, qui relie Bishkek et Osh puis se poursuit au [Tadjikistan](:Tajikistan:P1). Il traverse de hautes montagnes par des cols à plus de 3000 m, longe le splendide barrage aux eaux turquoise de Toktogul puis la plaine de la Ferghana en passant par Osh, une ancienne étape de la Route de la Soie. Il donne accès à de très belles excusions vers des lacs de montagne et les célèbres forêts de noyers d'Arslanbob.
Avant de quitter la capitale, vous pouvez faire quelques excursions en montagne. Ne vous attendez pas à être seuls, vous êtes ici très près de la capitale et les vallées sont très fréquentées par les urbains qui viennent s'aérer le week-end. Vous pouvez en particulier visiter  les callées d'Ala-Archa, Alamedin ou Issyk Ata.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Traverser le pays à travers des paysages variés et spectaculaires.
Accéder aux itinéraires [K5](::K5), [K6](::K6) et [K7](::K7) qui amènent au célèbre lac [Song Kul](?Song Kul).
Osh, le point de départ (ou d'arrivée) de la [Pamir Highway](:Tajikistan:P1).
La plaine de la Ferghana.
La très célèbre vallée d'[Ala Archa](Ala Archa), un beau point de départ vers des randonnées menant au pied des glaciers (entrée payante).
La vallée d'Alamedin, relativement moins fréquentée, avec son [sanatorium](Sanatorium Alamedin) du plus pur style soviétique.
La vallée d'[Issyk Ata](Issyk Ata) dans laquelle vous trouverez aussi des piscines d'eau chaude (assez fréquentées par les locaux).

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
La route est ouverte toute l'année. Elle est entièrement goudronnée et ne présente aucune difficulté hormis l’altitude des cols de Töö-Ashuu et d’Alabel où des chutes de neige peuvent survenir même en été.
Les plus grands dangers sont la prolifération de radars tenus par des flics corrompus, la circulation ainsi que le mauvais goudron dans les lacets des cols.

itineraries.description: This detour is great for those who prefer off-road tracks to the paved M41.
itineraries.highlights:
A welcome diversion from the M41.
Out-of-this-world landscapes.
Visit interesting geological formations, such as a geyser and a hot spring.
itineraries.name: Bulunkul and Yashikul
itineraries.roadConditions: The track is a little difficult when it crossed a sretch of very disturbed terrain that could bog you down. Campers and normal cars should avoid it and take the paved road to reach Yashilkul.

translatedDesc.fr: Un très joli détour sur la route parfois monotone de la Pamir Highway, dans des décors inattendus et très photogéniques.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Un détour bienvenu sur la M41 qui est parfois montonne.
Des fantastiques paysages lunaires.
Des formations géologiques spectaculaires, comme un geyser ou une source chaude.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
La piste est très mauvaise et un peu difficile lorsqu'elle traverse des mouvements de terrain. Il faut n'y venir qu'avec un véhicule solide et adapté. En temps de pluie, attention à la boue.
Les camions et camping-cars devraient plutôt continuer sur la route principale goudronnée.

itineraries.description:
The northeast coast between Muscat and Sur is a fantastic region to explore, offering a mix of scenic wadis and beautiful beaches—most of which are easily accessible. As you drive along the main road, you can choose your detours: head toward the sea for a swim or venture into the mountains to discover the area's many wadis. Some are famous and attract many visitors, such as Wadi Al Arbiyyin, others are very quiet, but no less picturesque, such as Wadi Shab.
Most of the route is accessible to all vehicles, including big rigs, and any challenging roads—such as the steep final climb to Wadi Tiwi—are noted accordingly.
itineraries.name: Wadis and Beaches

translatedDesc.fr:
La côte nord-est entre Muscat et Sur est connue pour ses belles plages et ses wadis, la plupart faciles d'accès. Tout au long de cette route vous choisirez vos détours, soit côté mer vers une belle plage pour vous baigner, soit côté montagne vers un beau wadi pour une balade, et vous baigner également ! Certaines destinations sont très fréquentées, comme Wadi Al Arbiyyin, d'autres sont beaucoup plus tranquilles, comme Wadi Shab. Le gouffre de Bimmah est peut-être l'endroit le plus touristique, quoique pas le plus intéressant.
Cet itinéraire est facile, accessible à tous véhicules, y compris les camions, et quand ce n'est pas le cas c'est mentionné dans le descriptif, comme par exemple la montée vers Wadi Tiwi.

itineraries.description:
From Mörön there is a very good paved road giving easy access to Lake Khövsgöl. There is a rather extensive (for Mongolia) tourist infrastructure on the west shore, so you can spend some time there enjoying the lake. There are no road on the west side of the lake, beyond the few tourist ger camps. On the east shore, a (bad) road runs all the way to Khankh and to the Russian border, but the latter is closed to tourists, only Mongolians and Russians can cross it.
This route links the lake with the northern road about {->km 150} east of Mörön, through Chandman-Öndör.
Note that there is no road going all the way around the lake.
itineraries.highlights:
Lake Khövsgöl, the "blue pearl" of Mongolia.
Optionally, go to Tasagaanuur and organize a visit to the Tsataans.
Avoid as much as possible the boring [Mörön - Erdenet road](::T6).
itineraries.name: Khövsgöl
itineraries.roadConditions:
The road is paved between Mörön and Khatgal, then it's all gravel, but not too difficult.
The road to Darkhad, the region of the Tsataans, isn't very good but doable with a sturdy vehicle. It's a dead end though, you'll have to come back to Mörön.

translatedDesc.fr:
Depuis Mörön, une très bonne route goudronnée vous permet d'accéder facilement au lac Khövsgöl, la « perle bleue » de la Mongolie entourée par la forêt sombre de la taïga. Sur la rive ouest, vous trouverez une infrastructure touristique particulièrement développée (pour la Mongolie), mais c'est un bel endroit pour profiter du lac pour quelques jours. La route s'arrête après els derniers campements de yourtes, il n'y a pas moyen de faire le tour du lac en voiture ou à moto.
Une mauvaise piste remonte jusqu'à Khankh et à la frontière russe, mais celle-ci est fermée aux touristes.
En partant du lac, cet itinéraire permet de rejoindre la route Nord environ 150 km à l'est de Mörön, en passant par Chandman-Öndör.
Si vous vous sentez le courage d’affronter de très mauvaises pistes et des nuées infernales de moustiques, vous pourrez atteindre la dépression de Darkhad où vivent les Tsataans, des peuples éleveurs de rennes, connus pour leurs pratiques chamaniques.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Le lac Khövsgöl, la « perle bleue » de la Mongolie entourée par la forêt sombre de la taïga. 
Faire un long détour par Tasagaanuur et organiser une viste des Tsataans.
Une alternative très variée au goudron pas très intéressant de la route [Mörön - Erdenet road](::T6).

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
La route est goudronnée entre Mörön et Khatgal, ensuite ce ne sont que des (bonnes) pistes.
La route vers le Darkhad, la région des Tsataans, n'est pas excellente mais faisable avec un bon 4x4 ou une moto trail. Mais c'est un cul-de-sac, donc il faudra revenir à Mörön.

itineraries.roadConditions:
The road is paved between Srinagar and Kishtwar, including across Sinthan Top. Note that Sinthan Top closes in winter and opens late in the summer due to the quantity of snow falling on it.
The stretch from Kishtwar to Killar is often in poor state and has some challenging parts, particularly around the JK-HP border, but is not difficult anymore thanks to the new road avoiding the "cliffhanger". The road is mostly unpaved between Killar and Udaipur but work is ongoing to improve the road.
Sinthan Top, the only pass on this route, sees a lot of snow, so it can be cut off as late as May.
itineraries.highlights:
Kashmir alpine landscapes.
Secluded valleys of Himachal Pradesh.
Off the beaten path route, rarely used by tourists.
itineraries.description:
This seldom traveled itinerary links Kashmir with Himachal Pradesh, running along the Great Himalayan Range and crossing only one major pass, Sinthan Top. Once out of the very busy and populated Kashmir Vale, you'll take the famous Kishtwar-Killar-Keylong (KKK) road, which runs along the Chenab river. This is supposed to be the most dangerous road of India, but as you'll see later on, a deviation has been built that renders this itinerary much more bland. The area around Kishtwar is considered a hotbed of independentists, so you will encounter several checkpoints, depending on the current situation.
Srinagar-Kishtwar can be driven in one day, but it's much more enjoyable to break the journey in Kokernag or Daksum just before Sinthan pass, where there is a good choice of guest houses. Kokernag or Kishtwar to Killar is easily done in a day. You could get all the way to Lahaul and the start of the [Manali - Leh highway](::L1) without break, but it would be a very long day. Killar to Keylong or Jispa is half day, and Manali can be reached in one day.
If you're coming from Jammu, you can also skip Srinagar and rejoin this route at Kishtwar by turning east right after Patnitop tunnel.
itineraries.name: Srinagar - Kishtwar - Killar

itineraries.description: This is the most well-known way to reach Leh and has gained a famed status over the years. Although it is not difficult (in normal conditions), it is a spectacular road because it crosses some of the highest passes in Ladakh. The real difficulty here is to cope with the changes of altitude and be prepared for the possible altitude sickness.
itineraries.highlights:
Tackle a mythical route across the Himalayas.
Cross 2 passes over 5000 m (over 16,000 feet).
The moon-like landscapes of the More plains.
Stop to visit two of the most famous monasteries of Ladakh: Thiksey and Hemis.
itineraries.name: Manali - Leh
itineraries.roadConditions:
The highway has been improved over the years and is now almost all paved and easy, except for the top of the passes, which BRO (Border Roads Organization) struggles to keep in shape.
The road remains blocked by snow throughout the winter, usually between November and May, depending on the year, and between Darcha and Upshi.

itineraries.description:
Tso Moriri is one of the main destinations in Ladakh, and with only one village catering to all visitors, it can feel a bit crowded at times, especially during the monastery festival. That said, the journey to reach it is stunning, making the trip well worth it.
Keep in mind that Tso Moriri sits at an altitude of {^4500}, so if you plan to spend the night, ensure that you’re properly acclimatized to avoid altitude sickness.
itineraries.highlights:
Kyagar Tso and Tso Moriri, two stunning lakes.
Karzok Gompa, one of the highest monastery in Ladakh.
itineraries.name: Tso Moriri
itineraries.roadConditions: The road is almost entirely paved, so it's easy for all vehicles.
As of 2025 the roads are almost entirely paved, and will be 100% paved by the 2026 season. So it's accessible to all kind of vehicles.
itineraries.highlights:
Incredible monasteries situated in extraordinary places, such as Stongdey or Dzonkhul.
Make detours to gorgeous villages and natural wonders, such as Shila waterfall.
Visit very active monasteries in Karsha and Sani.
itineraries.description: If you're coming to Ladakh via Zanskar through the new [Shinku La road](::L5), or just passing through Padum, you should take a day to visit the many interesting places that are scattered within a few minutes of Padum. This itinerary makes a loop so as not to backtrack, as much as posible, but of course you can do only part of it, in either direction. It's nice to end the circuit at the end of the afternoon with a stop at Stongdey monastery, or across the valley at Karsha monastery, and admire the gorgeous sunset on the wide valley.
itineraries.name: Zanskar circuit

itineraries.description:
At the boundary between the Great Lakes basin and the Kangai highlands, this itinerary passes through two of the most spectacular and unusual places in Mongolia: Lake Khar and the Mukhart springs. Far from classic tourist sights, this region is rarely visited by foreigners. Here, you might meet Mongol tourists, who will definitely invite you to have a picnic with them, and they might share their vodka, too!
It's possible to make amuch shorter tour that takes you to one spring, the arch and Lake Khar Nuur: for this; you can just cut from step 2 to step 28. This could be done in a day.
itineraries.highlights:
Khar Nuur.
Murhart Springs, where sweet springs from the mountains meet sands from the desert, making for an unforgettable sight.
itineraries.name: Zavkhan Loop
itineraries.roadConditions: The detours in this route are very sandy, and there are several river crossings that will need to be forded. It is recommended that you are well equipped and have experience driving in sand. If you avoid the detours, the route is somewhat easier.

translatedDesc.fr:
A la limite entre la dépression des Grands Lacs et le massif des Khangaï, cet itinéraire passe par deux sites parmi les plus spectaculaires et les plus insolites de Mongolie : le lac Khar et les sources Mukhard.
Éloignée des circuits touristiques classiques, cette région est très peu fréquentée par les étrangers. Mais vous y rencontrerez quelques familles de touristes mongols qui vous inviteront certainement à partager leur pique-nique … et leur vodka !

translatedHighlights.fr:
Khar Nuur.
Les sources Mukhard, où les eaux douces et fraîches de la montagne et les sables du désert se rencontrent pour façonner des paysages saisissants.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Les détours sont très sableux et il y a plusieurs gués à franchir. Il est recommandé d’être bien équipé et d’avoir de l’expérience de conduite dans le sable. Si vous évitez les détours, le parcours est plutôt facile.

itineraries.highlights:
Pangong Tso from different view points.
Yaye Tso, a little visited but very photogenic lake.
itineraries.roadConditions: The road is good, almost entirely paved, so it's suitable for all vehicles.
itineraries.description:
Arriving in Pangong Lake, typically from [Leh](::L10) or from [Nubra](::L11), many travelers continue their journey toward [Hanle and Umling La](::L13) or [Tso Moriri](::L23). There are two main routes to reach this region: one follows the Indus via the gentle [Tsaga La](::L14), while the other takes you over Kaksang La, one of the highest passes in Ladakh. Although the Tsaga La route is often chosen for its easier gradient, the Kaksang La route is far more scenic, offering dramatic high-altitude landscapes.
Even if you're planning to return directly to Leh, it's well worth driving along the lake for its spectacular viewpoints and the mesmerizing, ever-changing colors of Pangong Tso.
itineraries.name: Pangong - Kaksang La

itineraries.highlights:
A scenic alternative to the main road.
The gorgeous Waris valley, a worthwile detour is you have time.
itineraries.name: Waris Valley
itineraries.roadConditions:
The road is almost entirely paved, although a stretch is subject to frequent rock falls, and some sand is blown on top of the road near the Waris valley head.
Note that the [first bridge](:::2) is very narrow, fine for bikes but only small cars would be able to cross, with centimeters to spare on each side.
itineraries.description:
This route runs along the Shyok on the other bank of the river. This is a great alternative to the main Hundar - Turtuk road, especially since this stretch until the Waris bridge is in bad shape (in 2025). But to cross the river, a very narrow bridge allows only the bikes and small cars but just. The Waris bridge is wide and allows heavy vehicles to cross.
The Waris valley is very scenic and easily reachable on a paved road. You can continue on beyond Waris village on a rougher road, until you reach a high pasture. Beyond the rocky glacier that fills the end of the valley are the first Pakistani outposts. An [army checkpoint](Waris valley checkpoint) will turn you back if you get that far.

There are 2 routes to the Pamirs from Dushanbe: this is the easiest. It is all tarmac and it crosses only shallow passes, before following the Panj River along Afghanistan, so it's open all year long.
There's not much to see along the way but the scenery is great.
itineraries.highlights:
The Nurek Dam, a good place to break up the journey, although it's not very far from Dushanbe.
The Hulbuk Fortress, which looks like new.
The salt mountain of Koja-Mumin, an interesting geological feature to see in person if you have time.
itineraries.name: Kulob road
itineraries.roadConditions: The road is paved all along, and it's passable all year long. Beware of the heavy traffic.

translatedDesc.fr: Vous avez le choix entre deux routes pour aller au Pamir: celle-ci est la plus facile. Vous n'y trouverez pas d'attraction majeure, mais le paysage est splendide, quoiqu'un peu moins varié que la [route](::P1) par le col de Khaburabot.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Le barrage de Nurek, un bon endroit pour bivouaquer.
La forteresse reconstruite d'Hulbuk, qui ne mérite guère plus qu'un tour extérieur.
La montagne de sel de Koja-Mumin, une curiosité géologique qui ne mérite pas forcément le détour.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Elle est entièrement goudronnée et ne franchit pas de haut col, donc elle est ouverte même en hiver. Cela veut aussi dire que tous les camions passent par là.

itineraries.description:
This itinerary is a welcome change from the rather boring and busy Southern route. After this, you can either reach the Altai and the Southern route or you can continue to Sharga and Tsetseg until you rejoin the Southern route at Darvi or Mankhan.
Fuel range needed is about {->km 300} if you've fueled up in Bayanknongor, {->km 320} if you've taken fuel in Bömbögör (coming from the east, repectively from the west on the Southern Route).
itineraries.highlights: Ulaan Yabar, a canyon carved out of magnificent red rocks that bring you to Khaliun valley.
itineraries.name: Bayankhongor - Mankhan
itineraries.roadConditions: The route is unpaved but easy, except for a stretch in the canyon where the track is sometimes washed away by rain. The first part is actually the old Souther Route, before it was paved and relocated firther north. On this stretch there's a river crossing which, as always, is tricky after it's been raining, but is normally quite easy.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire est une déviation bienvenue de la route Sud assez ennuyeuse et encombrée de travaux. 
Cet itinéraire passe à travers un canyon creusé dans des roches rouges magnifiques (Ulaan Yabar) pour rejoindre la vallée de Khaliun. De là vous pouvez rejoindre Altaï et la route Sud, ou alors poursuivre sur les pistes par les itinéraires A3, A4 et A2 juqu`à Olgii.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Une alternative variée sur de bonnes pistes.
Ulaan Yabar, un superbe canyon aux roches colorées.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
La route est non goundronnée mais facile, sauf le passage en canyon où la piste peut-être partiellement emportée par les crues.
La première partie emprunte l'ancien tracé de la route Sud, avant qu'elle soit reconstruite et goundronnée plus au nord. Il faut franchir un gué qui, comme toujours, est d'habitude facile mais qui devient problématique après les pluies.

itineraries.description:
North and east of Murghab is a vast, flat area that stretches to the Chinese border. In the middle are two magnificent lakes in a desert landscape, Shorkul and Rangkul Lakes. The first, the smaller, is brackish, while the second is a freshwater lake.They are a biodiversity hotspot for birds, especially migratory birds. 
The site is listed by Birdlife International, an international non-governmental organisation dedicated to conserving nature and birds. Also note that the swampy banks attract a large number of mosquitoes in the summer.
To avoid a round trip, this route takes you to a little-known pass to rejoin the Kulma road and return to Murghab. The road is not difficult and can easily be done in half a day, or a full day if you include a picnic and photos.
itineraries.highlights:
Two very nice lakes that offer good birding opportunities.
An very enjoyable round trip on good tracks nor far from Murghab.
itineraries.name: Rangkul
itineraries.roadConditions: Good tracks suitable for any vehicle with reasonable clearance.

translatedDesc.fr:
Une large plaine s'étend au nord et à l'est de Murghab et jusqu'à la frontière chinoise. Au milieu se trouvent deux lacs magnifiques dans des paysages désertiques. Le premier, le plus petit, est saumâtre alors que le second est un lac d’eau douce. Ce sont des hauts lieux de biodiversité pour les oiseaux, en particulier les migrateurs. Le site est classé par la Birdlife international, une organisation non gouvernementale internationale à vocation de protection de la nature et des oiseaux. Notez aussi que les rives marécageuses hébergent des nuées de moustiques en été. 
Pour éviter un aller-retour, cet itinéraire prend un raccourci à travers un col peu connu pour rejoindre la route de Kulma et revenir à Murghab.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Deux beaux lacs d'altitiude connus des ornithologues.
Une boucle pas très difficile sur de belles pistes non loin de Murghab.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Les pistes ne sont pas difficiles (sauf le petit col, pas fait pour les camping-cars) et la boucle peut se faire en une demi-journée, ou une journée entière avec la pause pic-nic et les photos.

itineraries.description:
Wadi Sahtan is a great destination not far from Muscat. It forms a large bowl where there are many roads and villages to explore. The highlight is to reach Yasib through a very steep road cut into the face of a cliff. Very impressive. The surface is gravel but in good shape, so it is accessible to any vehicle, although big rigs should be prepared for steep, tight turns. Going down, the heavy vehicles must be sure to use power braking so as not to overheat their brakes.
The other attrraction is an excellent camp spot with stunning view on Jebel Shams at sunrise.
You can mix this route with [Snake Canyon](::Om5) which linked by a good track, and soon [Jebel Shams](::Om7) although the road has been under construction for some time.
itineraries.name: Wadi Sahtan

translatedDesc.fr:
Wadi Sahtan est une magnifique destination non loin de Muscat. Le wadi forme une large cuvette où l'on trouve de nombreuses pistes et villages à explorer. Le clou est la montée vers Yasib par une piste très raide construite dans la falaise. La piste est non goudronnée mais en bon état, donc elle est accessible à tous les véhicules, sauf peut-être les camions qui devront négocier des virages serrés avec des fortes pentes.
L'autre attrait est la vue exceptionnelle sur le Jebel Shams, surtout au lever du soleil. Vous pouvez enchaîner cet itinéraire et le [Snake Canyon](::Om5) en prenant une bonne piste, et bientôt on pourra même continuer vers [Jebel Shams](::Om7), quoique la route soit en construction depuis quelque temps.

itineraries.description:
This short trip takes one of the most remote road in Oman to reach an abandoned (?) village nested at the bottom of Wadi Tiwi. The road is so steep (20-25%) that it could be dangerous if you don't know very well your vehicle. Fortunately, the steepest parts are paved, but it still preferrable to drive it with a 4WD car, or a powerful motorbike. Big rigs and campers should in no case venture there.
There is an excellent camp spot near the bottom to spend the night.
itineraries.name: Wadi Tiwi top

translatedDesc.fr:
Cette petite excursion depuis l'[itinéraire 11](::Om11) est un aller-retour sur une des routes les plus isolées d'Oman, pour aller visiter un village abandonné (?) niché au fond de Wadi Tiwi. Attention toutefois, la route est si raide (20 - 25%) qu'elle pourrait être dangereuse si vous ne maîtrisez pas parfaitement votre véhicule. Heureusement, les passages critiques sont bétonnés, mais de toute façon il est préférable d'y aller en 4x4 ou avec une bonne moto. Les camions en tout cas ne devraient jamais s'y aventurer, ni les camping-cars.
Vous trouverez un excellent coin de bivouac dans un petit vallon si vous voulez y passer la nuit.

itineraries.description:
This itinerary takes you on a trip to the Khentii Mountains. You will discover the diversity of Mongolian landscapes: a mosaic of steppe and forest.
Due to the proximity of the capital, you will find more tourists here than anywhere else in the country, especially during weekends when UB's inhabitants come for a picnic.
itineraries.highlights:
Great camping spots.
Rocks of strange shapes carved by erosion.
Climb inside the monumental statue of Genghis Khan.
Visit Buddhist monasteries and decipher steles engraved with 1300 year old writings.
itineraries.name: Terelj Park
itineraries.roadConditions: Almost entirely paved, these are easy tracks (unless it rains). The detour to the temple of Gunjin Sum is slightly more difficult because of the river crossing.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire vous emmène pour une escapade dans les montagnes des Khentii. Vous découvrirez la diversité des paysages mongols composés d’une mosaïque de steppe et de forêt.
Du fait de la proximité de la capitale, vous trouverez plus de touristes qu'ailleurs, particulièrement pendant les week-ends où les résidents de la capitale viennent pique-niquer.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Des bivouacs au bord de magnifiques rivières.
Des rochers aux formes étranges sculptés par l’érosion.
Grimpez à l’intérieur de la statue monumentale de Gengis Khan.
Visitez des monastères bouddhistes et remontez le temps en déchiffrant les stèles gravées d’inscriptions vieilles de 1300 ans.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Presque entièrement goudronné, et sinon les pistes sont faciles (sauf après la pluie). Le détour par le temple de Gunjin Sum est légèrement plus difficile (passage à gué).

itineraries.description:
The Roof of the World—who hasn't dreamed of traveling this legendary route through one of the most remote places on Earth? The landscapes are spectacular and diverse. You'll start in the fertile plains of the Fergana Valley and ascend to the arid, wind-swept high plateaus of the remote Murghab region, passing by Karakul, one of the most beautiful high-altitude lakes in the world. From there, you'll descend into deep valleys at the foot of towering peaks capped with eternal snow. Finally, the road follows and descends along the Panj River, which forms the Afghan border. Many excursions into even wilder regions are possible, but they require a sturdy vehicle.
You'll often see this road called the M41, as it was known during the Soviet Union.
itineraries.highlights:
A mythical route on every adventurer's to-do list.
The moon-like landscapes of the high Pamir plateau.
Picturesque high-altitude lakes that are easily accessible: Yashilkul and Karakul.
Meet the Pamiris, a people distinct from the Tajiks of the plains.
Bathe in an open-air hot spring.
itineraries.name: Pamir Highway
itineraries.roadConditions:
The road is only partly paved, and when it is the tarmac is in bad shape, except for the stretch between [Kalai-i-Khumb](:::26) and [Khorog](:::22) which has recently been rebuilt. The stretch between Khorog and [Murghab](:::10), which used to be rather good, has suffered from poor maintenance and is now severly degraded, with deep potholes.
The unpaved stretch across the [Khaburabot pass](Khaburabot pass) can be avoided by taking the [Kulob road](::P12).

translatedDesc.fr:
Le toit du monde. Qui n'a pas rêvé de parcourir cette route mythique, aussi appelée route M41, dans un des endroits les plus isolés du monde ?
Les paysages sont spectaculaires et variés. Vous partirez de la plaine fertile de la Fergana pour grimper sur les hauts plateaux arides et ventés de la région reculée de Murghab, en longeant Karakul, un des plus beaux lacs d'altitude au monde. Puis vous redescendrez dans des vallées profondément encaissées au pied des hauts sommets coiffés de neiges éternelles. Enfin, la route rejoint et descend la rivière Panj qui marque la frontière afghane. De nombreuses excursions vers des régions encore plus sauvages sont possibles mais nécessitent un véhicule robuste.
Attention, les gains d'altitude sont très rapides, donc attention au mal des montagnes.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Une route mythique que tous les voyageurs ont envie de faire une fois dans leur vie.
Les paysages lunaires du plateau du Pamir.
De magnifiques lacs d'altitude facilement accessibles: Yashilkul and Karakul.
Recontrer les Pamiris, une ethnie distincte des Tadjiks.
Aller se baigner en plein air à 3000 m dans une source chaude.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
Cet itinéraire emprunte la route du [col de Khaburabot](Khaburabot pass) qui n'est pas goudronné, et parfois, en début de saison, en mauvais état. Ensuite la route a été récemment refaite entre [Kalai-i-Khumb](:::26) et [Khorog](:::22). La section entre Khorog et [Murghab](:::10), qui était en bon état il y a quelques années, a souffert du manque d'entretien et le goudron est maintenant en très mauvais état avec de gros nids-de-poule. Le passage du col de Kyzyl-Art est en mauvais état et peut être enneigé quelle que soit la saison.
La variante par [Kulob road](::P12) vous évite la piste du [col de Khaburabot pass](Khaburabot pass). C'est aussi la seule route pour accéder au Pamir pendant l'hiver.

itineraries.description:
This itinerary allows for a nice break in the wilderness near Ulaanbaatar visiting Khustai Nuruu Park. It is known for its population of Przewalski's horses, but you will also find many archeological remains.
On the way back to Ulaanbaatar you will drive along the Tuul, a river of major importance in the history of the country since the Mongols chose to settle their capital along its banks.
If you’ve already spent several weeks in complete freedom outside of the capital, you will be shocked by the price of the tickets to enter the park (35,000 tugriks), and also by the fact that camping is restricted to designated, equipped camping spots. It’s probably necessary, given the fact that the capital is in close proximity, the ecosystem is fragile, and it is home to the largest collection of carved stone statues dating back to the Turkic era.
itineraries.highlights:
Spot Przewalski's horses in the wild.
See balbals and tumuli.
itineraries.name: Khustain Nuruu
itineraries.roadConditions: The route has mostly good roads, you will only need 4WD if you get off the tracks that criss-cross the park.

itineraries.description:
This scenic drive winds through a narrow gorge, following the course of a wadi. Much of the road lies in the riverbed, so avoid taking this route if there is any chance of rain. The journey is slow, requiring navigation through shallow puddles and over river rocks. While 4WD is not essential, a vehicle with high clearance is a must. The narrow road is unsuitable for large rigs, and motorcyclists should be ready to handle loose gravel.
Camping in the wadi is possible if the weather is good, and next to the track, which isn't a problem as nobody drives there during the night.
The highlight of this route is the challenging hike to a hidden cave, which contains a pool of crystal-clear water—a rewarding find for intrepid explorers.
itineraries.name: Wadi Nakhur

translatedDesc.fr:
Wadi Nakhur se situe au pied de Jebel Shams, une gorge très étroite au find de laquelle on trouve 2 villages, dont un abandonné. Une piste tracée dans le lit de la rivière permet d'y accéder. Par temps sec, on roule dans les galets et de petites mares, mais si le temps est à l'orage, bien entendu que l'endroit peut être très vite noyé sous la rivière, donc faites bien attention à la météo. Cette piste n'est pas adaptée aux camions ni aux camping-cars, et les motards doivent être prêts à rouler dans les galets et le gravier. Vous pouvez camper dans le wadi, même à côté de la piste, car personne ne l'emprunte la nuit; mais de nouveau, prenez garde à la météo.
Le parcours dans la gorge est spectaculaire et agréable, mais le clou de l'itinéraire est la balade à pied qui mène depuis la fin de la piste vers une grotte où se niche une vasque d'eau cristalline.

itineraries.description:
This route follows one of the rare roads that cross the [Al Hajar Mountains](?Oman Geology), the rocky backbone of Oman. You will discover landscapes of raw and striking beauty. Here, the relief is powerful: the mountains, reaching up to 3,000 m, are carved by narrow and deep canyons (see geology insert). Towering limestone cliffs, sheer and striated with geological layers, rise above wadis with turquoise waters.
