Spend a few days exploring the charm of Srinagar, then make your way to Leh, taking detours along the way to visit ancient monasteries and follow little-used mountain roads that pass through authentic Ladakhi villages.
No permit is needed on this route.
itineraries.roadConditions:
The road is generally good and paved all the way, except on top of Zoji La, which doesn't get the same maintenance, maybe because it'll be replaced by the tunnel in the future. This is the only difficulty of this route.
The road opens when Zoji La opens, which is generally between mid-April and November. It sometimes reopens as early as February, though avalanches sometimes close the pass during the Spring. When the tunnel is completed, it will be open all year round.
itineraries.highlights:
Green Kashmir meadows.
Majestic Zoji La.
Lamayuru monastery.
Detour to visit the Sham valley villages.
itineraries.name: Srinagar - Leh

itineraries.description: Not far from Murghab, this valley is an excellent destination to enjoy a great camp or to start a trek toward the Madian valley.
itineraries.highlights:
Beautiful camping spots in a green valley.
Access to excellent trekking routes.
itineraries.name: Pshart valley
itineraries.roadConditions: Good double-track, high-clearance necessary after step 3.

translatedDesc.fr: A quelques km de Murghab, cette vallée est un très bel endroit pour installer un campement et se relaxer, ou comme point de départ d'un trek vers la [vallée de Madian](::P10).

translatedHighlights.fr:
Une belle vallée verte pour bivouaquer.
Partir en trek si vous êtes amateur.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Bonne piste facile au fond de la vallée, plus difficile après le point 3 et jusquà le fin de la route.

itineraries.description: This route is in some ways the classic Mongolian tourist itinerary. It passes through three unmissable and readily accessed sites of the Gobi desert: Bayanzag, Yolyn Am and Khongoryn Els. You'll probably see many other tourists around this route, which may feel unusual in Mongolia, because it is extremely picturesque, but keep in mind that it is easy to camp away from the popular ger camps, and spend a magical night in complete silence.
itineraries.highlights:
See the fire cliffs of Bayanzag, famous for their incredible colors and the quantity of fossilized dinosaur bones and eggs. Hike in the [Yolyn Am](?Yolyn Am) canyon, where ice persists even in the summer.
Climb the massive singing sand dunes of [Khongoryn Els](?Khongoryn Els).
Drive through the quite narrow gorge of Düngenee Am where cars can only just pass through.
Camp under the stars in incredible spots.
itineraries.name: Khongoryn Els
itineraries.roadConditions: Until Yoliin Am, the road is paved and suitable to any vehicle. The stretch through Düngenee Am is rough, steep and very narrow, so high clearance is a must. But big rigs can avoid it by staying on the paved road until [Bayandalai](:::7). As you get closed to Khongoryn Els the track understandibly becomes more sandy, so a 4WD is strongly recommended and bikers need to be prepared for this. The last part is gravel and easy for most vehicles.

translatedDesc.fr: Ce circuit est l'itinéraire classique des agences de tourisme. Il passe par les trois sites incontournables et les plus accessibles du Gobi : Bayanzag, Yoliin Am et Khongoryn Els, avec un détour pour la photo obligatoire de votre 4x4 ou moto dans le canyon de Düngenee Am. Même si on est donc sûr de rencontrer d'autres touristes, cet itinéraire reste une magnifique boucle, sachant qu'il est toujours possible de s'éloigner des camps de guer pour bivouaquer dans le silence le plus total.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Les falaises de feu de Bayanzag célèbres pour leurs splendides couleurs et leur richesse en ossements et œufs de dinosaures.
Le canyon de Yoliin Am où de la glace perdure pendant l’été.
Les immenses dunes de sables chantants de Khongoryn Els.
La gorge très étroite de Düngenee Am où les 4x4 passent tout juste

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
La route est goudronnée jusqu'à Yoliin Am. Le détour par Düngenee Am est cassant, raide et très étroit, donc il vous faut un véhicule léger et bonne garde au sol. Les camions peuvent éviter ce passage en restant sur la route goudronnée jusqu`à [Bayandalai](:::7). Au fur et à mesure que vous vous approchez de Khongoryn Els, le sable devient plus profond et mou, donc un 4x4 est fortement recommandé, et les motards doivent savoir rouler sur le sable.
La dernière partie est une bonne piste en dur, facile pour tous les véhcules.

itineraries.description: This itinerary is rarely used, it is a long detour from the main Bishkek-Osh road but it's an interesting one, on good roads. The Talas Valley may not be the most picturesque destination for the casual visitor, but its cultural significance is undeniable.
itineraries.highlights:
The stunning [Lake Besh Tash](Besh Tash Lake), a great place to camp and even swim.
The remote [Ak-Kol](Ak-Kol Lake) lakes, another great picnic spot.
[Prophet Ydrys Mausoleum](Prophet Ydrys mausoleum), not as important to us as it is to the locals, but an interesting insight into the Kyrgyz spirituality.
Hike in the amazing [Sary-Chelek](:::11) and [Kara-Kamysh](::K24:5) parks.
itineraries.name: Talas loop
itineraries.roadConditions: Almost entirely paved, and if not the gravel roads are vey good.

translatedDesc.fr: Cet itinéraire peut être vu comme un grand détour sur la route [Bishkek - Osh](::K1), et il est peu fréquenté, quoique pas dénué d'intérêt. La vallée de Talas n'est peut-être pas la destination la plus pittoresque pour le visiteur occasionnel, mais son importance culturelle est indéniable.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Le superbe [lac Besh Tash](Besh Tash Lake) dans son écrin de montagnes enneigées.
Les moins connus lacs [Ak-Kol](Ak-Kol Lake), un bel endroit de camping et picnic.
Le [mausolée du prophète Ydrys](Prophet Ydrys mausoleum), qui ne revêt pas la même importance pour nous mais qui reflète la spiritualité du peuple kirghize.
Des fantastiques randonnées dans les parcs de [Sary-Chelek](:::11) et de [Kara-Kamysh](::K24:5).

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Les routes sont en grande partie goudronnée, et lorsque cela n'est pas le cas elles sont en bon état.

itineraries.roadConditions: As is often the case, the road is paved near the valley floor, while the top of the passes isn't. The stretch between the two passes is paved but quickly deteriorating, so not in a good dhape, but passable with any vehicle.
itineraries.name: Umba La
itineraries.description:
This little-known "shortcut" links Dras on the [Srinagar - Kargil highway](::L2) directly to Sankoo in the [Suru valley](::L7). If you're heading to Zanskar from Srinagar, it’s a great alternative to avoid going through Kargi, which traditionally is an overnight stop thanks to its wide range of hotels, but not particularly remarkable otherwise.
The route is short and not difficult, with spectacular views from the top, overlooking both the Dras and Suru valleys. While it may not save a lot of time, since the main road through Kargil is wide and fast, it sees far less traffic, making for a more relaxed and scenic drive.
Be aware that in spring or autumn, the pass may be blocked by snow or affected by rockfalls, which can take time to clear.
Fuel is available in Sankoo, so range isn’t a concern, and you’ll find guesthouses both in Sankoo and throughout the Suru Valley.
itineraries.highlights:
A rarely used pass, more relaxed than the main highway.
Great vistas on both sides of the pass.

Hikkim, Komic, and Kibber — among the highest inhabited villages in India — offer a glimpse into life at extreme altitudes.
Ride some of the last remaining gravel roads in Spiti while you still can, before they all get paved.
Key Gompa, perched dramatically above the valley — arguably the most iconic of Spiti’s many monasteries.
itineraries.roadConditions:
The first stretch of this route, from the Demul road to Komic is unpaved and rough. While not technically difficult, it does require some off-road experience. It's the best gravel section in all of Spiti for the afficionado. Reaching Komic from Kaza via Langza is straightforward, thanks to the newly paved road. However, the old unpaved road to Hikkim is still accessible for those who prefer gravel riding.
Similarly, the road from Kaza to Key Gompa and Kibber can be done in any vehicle, though the stretch between Chicham and the Kunzum La road is partially unpaved.
itineraries.description:
Spiti is a wide valley, but apart from the main road running along its floor, there are few opportunities for side trips. If you've arrived from Shimla, you've already passed the entrance to Pin Valley—one of the few side valleys that can be explored by vehicle—located on the west side of the river. The short detour to Dankhar is another option, this time on the eastern side. This route takes you to the high-altitude villages above the valley floor, following a mostly off-road itinerary. While not technically difficult, it does require some off-roading experience.
It'll take a full day to enjoy this route, but of course you can also break it up in two days, for example Hikkim and Komic one day, and Kibber and Key another day.
itineraries.name: Spiti offroad

itineraries.description:
From Mörön to the east, the North Road is entirely paved. It continues through the mining towns of Erdenet and Darkhan, from which you can easily reach the Russian border to the north or Ulaanbaatar to the south.
This region is not the most interesting in Mongolia. It is home to important coal and copper mines around which industrial cities have popped up. It is also home to the few cultivated areas in Mongolia. The region is hilly and wooded and the slopes are gentle, so it is more interesting to visit on horseback than in a vehicle.
The main point of this leg of the route is to reach the Altanbulag/Kyakhta border post as quickly as possible, if you're headed to the Lake Baikal region, or to reach Lake Khövsgöl, coming from Ulaanbaatar.
If you’re headed for Ulaanbaatar, you can also leave the Northern Route at Bulgan and take a track to the southeast. It is slower but also less boring than the paved road through Darkhan.
itineraries.highlights: The monastery of Amarbayasgalant, one of the best preserved in Mongolia.
itineraries.name: Mörön - Darkhan
itineraries.roadConditions: Entirely paved, no difficulty.

translatedDesc.fr:
Depuis Mörön, la route Nord continue vers les grandes villes minières de Erdenet et Darkhan, d'où on rejoint facilement la frontière russe au nord ou Oulan-Bator au sud complètement sur le goudron.
Cette région n'est pas la plus intéressante de Mongolie. Elle abrite d'importantes mines de charbon et de cuivre autour desquelles ont été construites des villes industrielles. Par ailleurs, c'est aussi là que vous trouverez les rares zones cultivées de Mongolie. La région est vallonnée et boisée et les pistes y sont plus rares, elle est donc plus intéressante à visiter à cheval qu'en véhicule.
Le principal intérêt de cette route est de rejoindre au plus vite le poste-frontière d'Altanbulag/Kyakhta, quoiqu'un détour s'impose vers le monastère d'Amarbayasgalant, un des mieux conservés de Mongolie.
Pour rejoindre Oulan-Bator, il vaut mieux couper depuis Bulgan vers le sud-est. Le trajet n'est pas plus rapide, mais il est moins ennuyeux que le goudron par Darkhan.

translatedHighlights.fr: Le monastère d'Amarbayasgalant, un des mieux préservés de Mongolie.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Route entièrement goudronnée.

itineraries.description:
This route crosses the mountains of Jabal Bani Jabir on very steep tracks which makes for a spectacular drive. It's also a great destination to just enjoy swimming in the blue pools of Wadi Bani Khalid and Wadi Hawer. During the hotter months, the pools and the altitude of the route ({^1700}) is refreshing.
The road is paved and easy until Wadi Bani Khalid, which is a major destination. After that, the gravel road the crosses the mountain is generally very good. It is very steep, but the steepest parts have been paved so it is accessible by all vehicles, with the exception of big rigs which may have trouble in the steep and windy curves.
itineraries.name: Bani Khalid - Tiwa

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire traverse les montagnes de Jebel Bani Jabir par de petites routes très escarpées et spectaculaires, un vrai plaisir à moto ou en voiture - les camions et les campings-cars y seront par contre à la peine. On aura aussi l'occasion de se baigner dans les très belles vasques de Wadi Bani Khalid et Wadi Hawer. Pendant les mois les plus chauds, la fraîcheur due à l'altitude du tracé (1000 - 1700 m) et les arrêts baignade sont appréciés.
La route jusqu'à Wadi Bani Khalid est goudronnée et excellente, car c'est une destination très prisée. Ensuite c'est une autre histoire: la piste qui traverse la montagne est généralement bonne et les passages les plus pentus ont été bétonnés, donc elle n'est pas très difficile, néanmoins les virages serrés et raides seront compliqués pour les plus gros véhicules.

itineraries.description: If you want to head off the beaten path, you can easily lose yourself in the alpine meadows that envelop the bases of snow-capped mountains. If you like challenging, sparsely trafficked routes, this itinerary is for you. There are two high passes to cross, and isolated tracks, sometimes in poor condition, which connect the Suusamyr valley to Lake Song Kul. You'll go through very few villages, but you can meet nomads, learning about their lifestyle, spending time in yurts, trying their homemade cheeses, and tasting honey from the alpine surroundings.
itineraries.highlights:
Remote and difficult tracks crossing high passes.
Climb to Song Kul via the less used and roughest passes.
Visit the underground Chon-Tuz spa, a very strange place.
itineraries.name: Karakol Pass
itineraries.roadConditions: This itinerary is only possible between July and August, when the snow has melted. There isn't any fuel on this route, so if you need any, take a detour to either Kochkor or Chaek. The tracks are unpaved and sometimes in a very bad shape, depending on the road work (or lack thereof).

translatedDesc.fr: Si vous désirez sortir des sentiers battus, vous perdre dans d’immenses pâturages fleuris encadrés de hauts sommets enneigés, si vous aimez les routes difficiles et peu fréquentées, cet itinéraire est fait pour vous. Deux hauts cols à franchir et des pistes isolées, parfois en mauvais état relient la vallée de Suusamyr jusqu'au lac Song Kul. Vous ne traverserez que peu de villages, mais vous rencontrerez des nomades et partagerez leur mode de vie authentique sous leurs yourtes, goûterez leurs fromages et le miel de fleurs des hauts pâturages.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Des pistes diffciles à travers de hauts cols.
La montée vers Song Kul en utilisant les cols les plus difficiles et les moins fréquentés.
La visite du sanatorium souterrain de Chong-Tuz, un lieu très insolite.
Pour les cyclistes : connexion avec les cols difficiles de Kegety ou Shamshy.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Itinéraire possible seulement en juillet-août, lorsque la neige a fondu. Pas d'essence, si besoin faites un détour par Kochkor ou Chaek. Pistes pouvant être ravinées.

itineraries.description:
This off-road itinerary is a great way to avoid the boring main road from Toktogul to Osh, by reaching Arslanbob by somewhat difficult tracks, and from there, the main road at Jalalabad.
Easily accessible from the main [Bishkek - Osh highway](::K1), Kara Suu is a convenient stop to camp. During the summer, locals put up yurts and you can sleep in there.
itineraries.highlights:
Kara Suu, a great detour from the main road.
The famous walnut forest of Arslanbob, and its ouzbek culture.
An offroad route to reach Arslanbob by little-used tracks.
itineraries.name: Kara Suu - Arslanbob
itineraries.roadConditions:
A good gravel road connect the main road to Kara Suu. Locals use their Lada to get there.
The route to Arslanbob uses narrow single tracks, so it's not suitable for normal cars, campers or big rigs.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire est un excellent moyen d'éviter l'ennuyeuse route principale de Toktogul à Osh, en rejoignant Arslanbob par des pistes un peu difficiles, et de là, la route principale à Jalalabad.
Facilement accessible depuis la route principale [Bishkek - Osh](::K1), Kara Suu peut être un bon endroit pour s'arrêter et camper. Pendant l'été, les habitants y installent des yourtes et vous pouvez y dormir si vous n'avez pas de matériel de camping.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Kara Suu, un super détour depuis la route principale.
Les célèbres noyers d'Arslanbob, et sa culture ouzbèke.
Des belles pistes pas très roulantes pour les amateurs.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
Une bonne piste relie la route principale à Kara Suu. Les locaux y viennent d'ailleurs avec leurs Lada.
La piste pour Arslanbob emprunte d'étroites double-tracks, et n'est donc pas adaptée aux voitures normales, aux camping-cars ou aux gros camions.

itineraries.name: Spiti - Lahaul
itineraries.roadConditions:
The road from Kaza to Gramphoo is paved until the Chandratal intersection, unpaved but graded afterwards, and in rough shape. You should have a sturdy vehicle, and expect some mud and water crossings, especially in spring when there's still snow melting, or after heavy rains.
Kunzum La closes during the winter, it's open only between May or June and September to October.
itineraries.description:
Spiti is easily accessible [from the Shimla side](::L3), but from the Lahaul (and Manali) side, it's an unpaved road until Kunzum La, that, until 2025, was known as one of the roughest roads in the Himalayas. The minimum maintenance keep it barely open during the summer. You'll need a high-clearance vehicle to get through. Note also that there is no cellular connection on this route.
It is possible to complete the route in a single day, even to get as far as Manali, but many will choose to break the journey with an overnight stop near the pristine Chandratal Lake.
Note that a new road is being constructed between Tso Moriri and Kiato, so there will be an alternative in a few years.
itineraries.highlights:
Chandratal Lake.
A great trip into a remote, isolated region of Himachal Pradesh.

itineraries.description:
The Great Pamir is a very isolated plateau in a region that is itself remote, at the confluence of the highly strategic borders of China and Afghanistan and just a few kilometres as the crow flies from Pakistan. Adventurers will find destinations far from the usual tourist routes.
You'll follow in the footsteps of explorers in search of the springs of the Oxus. You'll reach magnificent lakes in wide glacial valleys, see ancient tombs of Silk Road pilgrims and ghostly ruins from the Soviet era. Along the way you can bathe in the hot springs of a hunting lodge.
The part of the route along the Afghan border is only accessible with an entry permit for the Zorkul Nature Reserve. Access is free as far as Jarty Gumbez, after which there are no systematic checks before Khargush. If you do not have valid papers, it will be difficult for the military to send you back to Zorkul, but they will be in a strong position to "negotiate" this problem with you... Coming from the Wakhan, on the other hand, you will be systematically turned back if you do not have a permit.
This permit is easily obtained in Khorog from [PECTA](PECTA Office) and in [Murghab](Murghab park office).
We describe this route starting from the M41, {->km 34} south of Murghab, but note that it can also be reached via the [Kulma road](::P8:3) or via [Tokhtamish](::P8:7), but not via [Kyzylrabot](Kyzylrabot).
itineraries.highlights:
The splendid Lake Zorkul.
A remote and seldom used route, where you'll meet hardly anyone.
The hot spring of Jarty Gumbaz and its very isolated hunting house.
The interesting detours by the Shakhty cave and the Shorbulag observatory.
itineraries.name: Zorkul
itineraries.roadConditions:
The route is entirely offroad, the tracks are rough and occasionally sandy. The dry lakes turn into a mud trap after the rains. You'll need a high-clearance vehicle, 4WD is not normally necessary (in dry conditions).
There is no fuel or any shop along this route.

translatedDesc.fr:
Le Grand Pamir est un plateau très isolé au sein d'une région elle-même éloignée de tout, à la confluence des frontières très stratégiques de la Chine et l'Afghanistan et à quelques kilomètres à vol d'oiseau du Pakistan. Les aventuriers y trouveront des pistes éloignées des itinéraires habituels des touristes.
Vous partirez sur les traces des explorateurs à la recherche des sources de l'Oxus, découvrirez de splendides lacs dans de larges vallées glaciaires, d'anciennes tombes des pèlerins qui parcouraient la Route de la Soie mais aussi de fantomatiques ruines de l'époque soviétique. En route, vous pouvez prendre un bain dans les sources chaudes aménagées dans un relais de chasse.
La partie de l'itinéraire qui longe la frontière afghane n'est accessible qu'avec un permis d'entrée dans la réserve naturelle de Zorkul. Jusqu'à Jarty Gumbez, l'accès est libre ; ensuite il n'y a pas de contrôle systématique avant Khargush. Si vous ne pouvez pas alors présenter des papiers en règle, il sera difficile aux militaires de vous renvoyer vers Zorkul, par contre ils seront en position de force pour « négocier » avec vous ce problème... En venant du Wakhan, en revanche, vous vous ferez systématiquement refouler si vous n'avez pas de permis.
Ce permis s'obtient très facilement à Khorog auprès de [PECTA](PECTA Office) à Khorog et à [Murghab](Murghab park office).
Nous décrivons ici cet itinéraire depuis la M41 à 34 km au sud de Murghab, mais notez qu'il est aussi possible d'y accéder par la route de Kulma ou par Tokhtamish, mais pas par Kyzylrabot.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Le superbe Lake Zorkul et ses eaux d'un bleu profond.
Une route isolée et rarment utilisée, où vou ne rencontrerez peut-être personne.
La source chaude de Jerty Gumbaz et son relais de chasse aux mouflons.
Les détours par la grotte de Shakhty et l'observatoire abandonné de Shorbulag.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
Les pistes sont assez cassantes, avec quelques passages de sable. Les lacs asséchés se transforment en bourbier après les pluies.
Il n'y a pas de carburant ni aucun magasin sur ce trajet.

itineraries.roadConditions: The road between Shimla and Kaza is very good, suitable for all vehicles. It is open year-round, thanks to the small amount of snow that falls on Nako La. The access to Chitkul is open from April to October.
itineraries.description:
Spiti is a remote valley in Himachal Pradesh near Tibet which is Buddhist and shares a language close to Ladakhi. It is strikingly beautiful and much quieter than Ladakh, so it definitely deserves a visit.
Unlike the high plateaus and wide valleys of Ladakh, the steep relief of Spiti doesn't offer many possibilities to get off the main road. Moreover, many of the secondary roads have been paved recently. In order to make the trip more interesting, some deviations are proposed on side valleys, both off- and on-road, that are less traveled and which give you more of a taste of the Spiti lifestyle.
Indian nationals can travel freely with just a valid ID. Foreigners need to get an Inner Line Permit to travel between Pooh and Sumdo. This can be obtained easily in Rekong Peo or in Kaza, depending on where you're travelling from (it can also be sourced in Shimla but that is more complicated). The permit is valid for 2 weeks and costs 200-400 rps per person.
Ideally, this route should be combined with the [Kunzum La route](::L20) to make a loop to Manali or to continue on to [Ladakh](::L1). But this road is one of the worst in the region, so if your vehicle isn't robust enough, or if you just don't enjoy the rough roads, you should turn around using the same road. If you wish to visit [Chandratal](Chandratal car park) though, you can do so on a quite good road from Kaza (overnight trip).
While in Kaza, spend at least a day exploring the [high villages](::L19) above Kaza.
itineraries.highlights:
Sunset mountain view from Kalpa.
Escape from the heat in Chitkul.
Komic, Hikkim and Kibber villages.
Dankhar and Key monastery.
itineraries.name: Kinnaur - Spiti

itineraries.highlights:
Tso Startspuk and Tso Kar.
A great diversion on the Leh - Manali highway.
itineraries.description:
As you drive from Manali to Leh, you’ll come across the turnoff to Thukje - a tempting proposition, as the rest of the route isn't that exciting. However, there's a catch: this area requires a special permit. For Indian nationals, this is relatively straightforward, as it can be done online (although patchy cell reception in the area may pose a challenge). For foreign nationals, however, permits can only be obtained in person in Leh.
For this reason, and also because it's not ideal to gain too much altitude too quickly when coming from Manali, many travelers prefer to take this route on the return journey, to avoid the Leh-Debring stretch which is already known.
::Fuel range::
When you reach the end of this route at the Manali–Leh highway, you will have covered at least {^95} from Nyoma and around 195 km from Karhu via the Mahe bridge. The next official fuel stations are either in Karhu (toward Leh, {^100} away) or in Keylong (toward Manali, {^225} away).
If you're planning to travel from Leh to Manali via Kso Tsar, you'll need a minimum fuel range of about {^430}. If you also plan to include a detour to Tso Moriri—a popular route—the total distance increases to approximately {^520}. That’s more than most standard motorbikes can cover on a single tank, so you'll need to plan accordingly. Your options are to carry extra fuel canisters, buy bottled fuel in Sumdo or Thukje, or make a detour to Nyoma, which will save you only about {^100} in range.
If you're coming from Manali and wish to do this route backwards, Nyoma is actually closer than Karhu, so you'll need only {^315} of range ({^80} more for a detour to Karzok).
itineraries.roadConditions:
The road is almost entirely paved, with the exception of the stretch over Pologongka La. However, this section is not particularly difficult—any vehicle can manage it.
If you choose instead to drive around the far side of Tso Kar, the route becomes significantly more challenging due to a deep water crossing. That said, the double-track along the south side of Tso Kar is in good condition and poses no major difficulties.
itineraries.name: Tso Kar

itineraries.highlights:
Shinku La, the first high pass on the way to Leh.
The sunset over Gonbo Ranjan.
The many monasteries in Zanskar valley.
The impressive Chadar road across very narrow gorges.
itineraries.roadConditions:
While the road up Shinku La on the Lahaul side is good and quite well maintained, the other side is particularly rough and steep, so it's difficult to predict when it becomes passable, usually not before June; the first snowfalls at the end of September close it down again for the winter.
It has also frequently been blocked by floods and rockfalls in the past, so similar disruptions remain likely. Between the Shinku La and Padum, the road is paved and in good condition.
On the other hand, the Chadar Road between Padum and Chilling is still narrow and only partially paved, so a sturdy vehicle is currently required to cross this section.
itineraries.name: Shinkula - Zanskar
itineraries.description:
This itinerary is exciting because it follows a newly opened route — the first section over Shinku La has been open since 2019, and the final stretch between Padum and Nimmu (Chadar road) was completed in 2024. The road has seen significant improvements in recent years and is now mostly paved, with water crossings now bridged, although parts of the Chadar Road are still in construction.
Adventurers may miss the challenge of the old gravel tracks, but others will welcome this new and easier way to reach Leh. Not only are the views along the route spectacular, but it also provides direct access to the Zanskar Valley, a region known for its natural beauty and rich cultural heritage.
While it’s possible to complete the journey in just two days, it’s best to allow three to four days for sightseeing and to account for potential delays due to ongoing roadwork, breaking the journey in Purne and Padum where there is a good choice of homestays and guesthouses. If you choose to take the longer but more interesting route across Singge La, you should sleep in Lamayuru and join Leh the next morning.
The long-term plan is to dig a tunnel under Shinku La, so that the road is passable year-round. But there's no sign as to if and when the work will actually start.
You should also allocate a full day of sightseeing in Padum and around, at a minimum, as there is a lot to see.
If you're starting from Manali and want to get directly to Padum, then watch for the symptoms of altitude sickness as there is a big jump in elevation. It's best to overnight in Keylong or Jispa to better acclimatize.
Travelling from Padum towards Darcha, it's best to sleep in Gombo Ranjan camp to admire the amazing sunset. Since you are probably well acclimatized, the altitude shouldn't be a problem, and the next morning you can start early to reach Manali in a leisurely manner.
This route is one of the most scenic itinerary in the country. It has fantastic views of the mountains, and passes by various historic sites, with Tash Rabat being the highlight.
itineraries.highlights:
The historically significant ruins of Shidarbek, a Khara-Kanid fortress.
Camp at the MELS pass with stunning views over the valley.
Tash Rabat, the most famous caravanserai in Kyrgyzstan.
Exciting detours for the off-road enthusiast.
itineraries.name: Kazarman - Tash Rabat
itineraries.roadConditions:
All gravel roads but in good shape, suitable for any vehicle.
The optional detour via Turasu, on other hand, is pretty rough and only for light bikes or sturdy 4WDs.

translatedDesc.fr: Cette route est l'une des plus attrayantes du pays. Elle offre des panoramas fantastiques sur les montagnes et passe par plusieurs sites historiques, dont Tash Rabat est le clou.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Les ruines pas si mal conservées de Shidarbek, une forteresse khara-kanide.
Le panorma depuis le col MELS, imprenable.
Tash Rabat, le caravansérail le plus célèbre du Kirghizistan.
Des détours intéressants pour les amateurs de tout-terrain.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
Les routes sont non goudronnées mais en bon état, pour tous véhicules.
Le détour par Turasu (optionnel) est par contre une double-track assez difficile.

itineraries.description:
While Pangong Tso is without a doubt a gorgeous lake, its reputation draws so many tourists that it feels very crowded at times, especially in the huge Spangmik tent camps.
Chang La is another highlight of this route. It can feel overly busy when hundreds of motorcycles join the dozens of cars on the pass, however the views on the way up or down make it worth the trip.
Tour companies often combine a visit of [Nubra](::L6) with Pangong via [Shyok](::L11) and on to Hanle via [Kaksang La](::L25) or [Tasaga La](::L14).
Chang La is open all year round because of its strategic importance, although snowfalls can be expected anytime.
The road is very good so even with a late start from Leh you can make it before dark to Spangmik. You can also push to Man or Merak for more accommodation options.
Note that the altitude of the lake ({^4200}) means that you should be well acclimatized if you wish to sleep there.
itineraries.name: Chang La - Pangong
itineraries.highlights:
Mesmerizing Pangong Tso.
Chang La, one of the highest passes in Ladakh, and a very easy one.
itineraries.roadConditions: The road is paved almost all the way, with only a few stretches in construction around Chang La. It is suitable to all kind of vehicles.

itineraries.description: The Northern Route connects the Tsagaannuur border post to Mörön, across the northern end of the Mongol-Altai Mountains, through the dry depression of the Great Lakes and over the wetter Khangai Mountains. It is the wildest and most varied route through the country.
itineraries.highlights:
Visit Mongolia’s two largest lakes: Lake Uvs and Lake Khövsgöl (acessible from Mörön via a paved road).
Set up camp near one of the most photogenic lake of Mongolia, Üüreg Nuur.
Tackle the most challenging route across Mongolia, much mroe difficult than either the Middle Route or the Southern Route.
itineraries.name: Northern Route
itineraries.roadConditions: The road is entirely unpaved, and sometimes in rough shape. In particular, the river crossings between Tsagaannuur and Ulaangom can be problematic after heavy rains, to the point that becomes impassable.

translatedDesc.fr: La route Nord relie le poste frontière de Tsagaannuur à Mörön en passant par l’extrémité nord des montagnes du Mongol-Altaï, la dépression aride des Grands Lacs puis les montagnes plus humides des Khangaï. C'est l'itinéraire le plus sauvage et le plus varié pour traverser le pays, mais aussi le plus difficile.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Voir de près les deux plus grands lacs de Mongolie: le lac Uvs and le lac Khövsgöl (acessible depuis Mörön par une route goudronnée).
Bivouaquer sur les rives du lacs Üüreg, un des plus beaux de Mongolie.
Traverser la Mongolie par un itinéraire bien plus difficile et moins fréquenté que la route Sud ou la route du Milieu.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Cette route, peu fréquentée, ne pose pas de problème particulier, sauf que plusieurs gués et cols doivent être franchis. Elle n'est pas adaptée aux véhicules type camping-car à faible garde au sol. Les gués ne sont pas profonds, mais peuvent devenir problématiques après de fortes pluies. Dans ce cas, faites le tour de l'Achit nuur par le sud ou empruntez l'itinéraire A1.

itineraries.description: For many travelers, this itinerary marks the beginning of the Pamir Highway, which continues into Tajikistan. However, it’s worth exploring even if you're not heading to Tajikistan, simply to enjoy the stunning views of Lenin Peak and the numerous trekking opportunities in the region. Closer to Osh, it also provides access to the greener Murdash Valley. Additionally, overlanders en route to China via the Irkeshtam Pass often stop in the area while waiting for a guide to accompany them into China. The base camp at Lenin Peak offers an exceptional camping experience, so plan to spend at least two days there.
itineraries.highlights:
Explore the very pretty Murdash valley.
Camp in front of Lenin Peak.
itineraries.name: Osh - Sary Tash
itineraries.roadConditions:
Good paved road all the way to Sary Tash and in the Alay valley.
From Sary Mogol to Lenin base camp, a high-clearance vehicle is necessary but 4WD is not.

translatedDesc.fr:
Pour beaucoup de voyageurs, cet itinéraire marque le début de la Pamir Highway, qui continue ensuite au Tajikistan. Pourtant, même si vous n'allez pas au Tajikistan, cet itinéraire est magnifique et vaut le détour juste pour les paysages spectaculaires qu'on y trouve.
Ceux qui se dirigent vers la Chine se donnent souvent rendez-vousà Sary Mogol ; et en attendant leur guide, ils pourront aller camper vers le pic Lénine.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Explorer la très jolie vallée de Murdash.
Camper au pied du pic Lénine.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
La route est goudronnée et en bon état jusqu'à Sary Tash et dans la callée de l'Alay.
Depuis Sary Mogol, la piste vers le camp de base du pic Lénine demande un véhicule avec une bonne garde au sol, mais le 4x4 n'est pas nécessaire.

itineraries.description:
Bar Al Hikman is a truly unique destination in Oman, offering a vast, flat desert expanse along the Gulf of Masirah. The southern beaches facing Masirah Island are the main draw for visitors, featuring endless stretches of white sand and turquoise waters so picturesque that some have nicknamed them the "Oman Maldives." This area is particularly renowned among kite surfers who flock there during the summer to take advantage of near-perfect conditions, as the steady khareef winds create ideal temperatures and constant breezes. In winter, the area remains just as stunning and is far less crowded.
Accessing Bar Al Hikman involves navigating desert tracks from the main paved road in the north to the sea. While many tracks lead there, only one is consistently easy to navigate. Other tracks can be challenging, with patches of soft sand or mud. This itinerary suggests taking the well-marked, reliable track on the way in and a more adventurous, difficult route on the way back. If you’re new to off-road driving, traveling solo, or seeking a simpler experience, stick to the main track (steps 2-3-7). It’s well-traveled and generally problem-free, with a higher chance of encountering others who can assist if needed. The other tracks, though more exciting, require self-sufficiency and confidence in handling off-road conditions.
One of the standout features is the salt pans (north of [step 11](:::11)), which at times are covered by a shallow layer of water, creating stunning photo opportunities. While the surface is usually firm enough to drive on, it's important to wash your vehicle’s underbody as soon as possible afterward, as the salty water is extremely corrosive.
Although this itinerary is labeled “difficult” due to these off-road challenges, a round-trip using only the main track is rated “normal” and suitable for all vehicles. 4WD is not really necessary if you stick striclty to the well-marked tracks, but highly recommended.
Facilities in the area are minimal, with only a couple of small hotels around the lagoons, primarily catering to kite surfers during the summer. These are open year-round but can get fully booked in high season. For campers, the coast offers endless incredible spots to pitch a tent, although the many tracks hugging the coastline can be sandy and more demanding than the main route.
You should bring enough water and food for your stay, as there are no shops in the area. Fuel is not an issue, as the lagoons are just {->km 45} from the main road, and the nearest fuel station is not far. This ensures easy logistics, leaving you free to focus on enjoying this extraordinary and remote part of Oman.
itineraries.name: Bar al Hikman

translatedDesc.fr:
Bar Al Hikman est une région très particulière d'Oman. C'est une grande plaine désertique très plate le long du golfe de Masirah, sans aucun relief ni végétation. Les plages qui font face à Masirah sont la raison pour laquelle les visiteurs se pressent ici, de grandes étendues de sable très clair qui donnent sur des eaux turquoises qui leur donnent le surnom de "Maldives d'Oman". L'endroit est très prisé par les kitesurfeurs qui apprécient les excellentes conditions de vent qui prévalent pendant l'été et les fonds peu profonds. De plus, ce vents de [#khareef#mousson#] tempèrent le climat qui n'est jamais aussi étouffant que dans le nord d'Oman. En hiver, les plages sont tout aussi superbes et l'eau est chaude, sans trop de vent, donc c'est un excellente destination de baignade sans les foules, car leur accès n'est pas aussi facile que sur le reste de la côte.
Pour rejoindre les plages depuis la route principale qui coupe plus au nord, il est important de bien choisir parmi les dizaines de pistes celle qui posera le moins de problèmes. Il est facile de se fourvoyer dans le sable mou et des mares de boue d'où il sera difficile de se sortir seul. Cet itinéraire vous propose une piste qui vous garantit presque à coup sûr une traversée sans souci, mais aussi un itinéraire alternatif pour revenir qui passe par des paysages extraordinaires mais qui peut être plus difficile à négocier. Si vous débutez dans la conduite offroad, ou si votre véhicule n'est pas très adapté, restez absolument sur la piste bien marquée à l'aller comme au retour (étapes 2-3-7). C'est une route qui voit un certain trafic tous les jours, donc si vous rencontrez des problèmes vous recevrez sûrement de l'aide. Notez qu'il n'y a pas de réception GSM dans cette région, ou de manière très ponctuelle.
Si par contre vous êtes aguerris à la conduite sur sable, vous êtes en groupe et vous préférez les bivouacs isolés, alors il existe quantités de pistes à explorer et des plages éloignées pour installer son camp. Bien sûr il faudra être en autonomie complète car il n'y a aucun village, donc aucun magasin ou restaurant et aucune source d'eau dans toute la région. Et pas d'internet bien entendu ! Toutefois, il existe deux lagunes où des campements louent des tentes ou des chambres aux touristes de passage, surtout en dehors de la période kite surf.
Un des clous de cet itinéraire est la traversée des déserts de sels, de vastes étendues parfaitement plates de sel couvertes par une fine couche d'eau, offrant des paysages irréels  (au nord de l'[étape 11](:::11)). Le couche de sel est en général suffisamment dure pour pouvoir y rouler sans risque de s'enliser, toutefois il est essentiel de laver son véhicule aussi vite que possible, car l'eau salée est très corrosive et peut faire des dégâts à long terme, mais aussi des problèmes électriques à court terme.
Cet itinéraire est marqué "difficile" à cause de ces passages offroad, mais si vous effectuez un simple aller-retour vers la lagune sur les traces principales, il est accessible à tous les véhicules même les camions et les camping-cars, en s'assurant toutefois de ne pas dévier des traces et de ne pas pénétrer sur les plages.
N'oubliez pas de faire le plein d'eau et de nourriture pour la durée de votre séjour. Le carburant n'est pas un problème, la station la plus proche n'est qu'à 50 km des lagons. Rien ne vous empêche donc de profiter au maximum de cette région tout à fait extraordinaire d'Oman.

itineraries.description:
The Sugar Dunes are a hallmark of Oman tourism. The sugar-white pristine dunes feature one every toursim agency flyer. They're rather easily accessible, 4WD being not completely necessary but highly recommended.
The Khaluf beach next to it is also famous for letting you drive on hard sand for {->km 6} straight.
Note that the popularity of the place means that the best camp spots on the beach may be busy during wekkends and holidays, but it's never crowded.
itineraries.name: Sugar Dunes

translatedDesc.fr:
Les Sugar Dunes ("Dunes de sucre", par rapport à la couleur du sable) est un haut lieu du tourisme Omanais, elles figurent sur toutes les brochures touristiques. Pour de bonnes raisons, car la vision de ces dunes au coucher de soleil est vraiment magnifique. En plus, la région est relativement facile à atteindre, un 4x4 n'étant pas strictement nécessaire, quoique hautement recommandé. Juste à côté de ces dunes, la plage de Khaluf est également connue, non pas pour ses qualités de baignade, mais pour pouvoir y rouler sur 6 kilomètres sur du sable dur, sans déranger personne.
Notez que la célébrité des Sugar Dunes implique que vous devrez partager les bivouacs sur la plage lors des week-ends et jours fériés, mais derrière les dunes il est toujours possible de trouver un endroit parfaitement silencieux.

itineraries.description: The Middle Route links Ulaangom to Kharkhorin before joining up with the Southern Route. It is the most varied and interesting route across Mongolia. It is also the longest in terms of kilometers, as well as the easiest, since most of it is paved.
itineraries.highlights:
The lakes and arid landscapes of the Great Lakes Depression.
The semi-wooded steppes of the Khangaï mountain range, which is the cradle of the Mongolian people. 
Visit remarkable archaeological sites and historical ruins.
Kick back in natural hot springs.
itineraries.name: Middle Route
itineraries.roadConditions: Almost entirely paved, so no difficulty at all.

translatedDesc.fr:
La route du Milieu, ralliant Ulaangom à Kharkhorin puis rejoignant la route Sud, est l’itinéraire le plus varié et le plus intéressant pour traverser la Mongolie. C'est aussi le plus long en terme de kilomètres, et le plus facile puisqu'une grande partie de l'itinéraire est goudronnée ou en passe de l'être.
Si vous préférez éviter la difficile route entre Olgii et Ulaangom, en venant de la Russie par l'ouest, vous pouvez rejoindre la route du Milieu facilement [depuis Khovd](::T4).

translatedHighlights.fr:
Les lacs et les paysages arides de la Dépression des Grands Lacs.
Les steppes semi-boisées du massif des Khangaï, le berceau des origines des peuples mongols.
Des sites archéologiques et des ruines historiques remarquables.
Se relaxer dans une sources chaude.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Presque entièrement goudronné, donc aucune difficulté.

itineraries.name: Nubra Valley
itineraries.roadConditions: The road on the left (east) bank of the Nubra is paved, on the other side it's partially unpaved but in very good shape.
itineraries.highlights:
The Panamik hot springs.
Little-visited Ensa gompa and Charasa Palace.
Yarab Tso, a so-called "hidden" lake with a great camping spot.
itineraries.titlePhotoCaption: Nubra Valley as seen from Charasa.
itineraries.description:
The Nubra Valley has historically been a vital trading route across the Himalayas. Caravans from Leh would cross Khardung La, Saser La, and the Karakoram Pass to reach Tibet. The altitude of the passes mattered less than their gradient and the feasibility of transporting heavily loaded camels and mules across them.
Today, the valley has become a dead-end due to geopolitical tensions with Pakistan and China — this territory is claimed by all three countries. The harsh environment of the Siachen Glacier has witnessed the highest-altitude warfare in history, at over {^5000}. In fact, more soldiers — both Indian and Pakistani — have died from exposure than from enemy fire.
Currently, the upper reaches of the valley are occupied by the Indian Army and are off-limits to tourists, except for Indian nationals with a special permit to visit the Siachen Base Camp.
The lower part of the valley, however, remains open and is incredibly scenic. It also offers several fascinating monasteries well worth a visit.

This itinerary connects Bishkek and Almaty, but not on the direct route through Korday. If you’re not in a hurry, it’s much more interesting to go along Lake Issyk Kul, then take the easterly bypass of the Kungay mountain range, which abuts the border of both countries. You won’t have any problem finding food and supplies along this route.
itineraries.highlights:
Visit the beautiful [Chong-Kemin](::K20) valley.
Go camp near the [Chon Aksu](::K21) lake.
Go swim in in the world’s third largest saline lake, Issyk Kul.
Stop to see remarkable [archaeological sites](::K2:7).
Marvel at sunken forest of [Lake Kaindy](Lake Kaindy) on the border with Kazakhstan.
Hike down the photogenic [Charyn Canyon](Charyn Canyon Camp).
itineraries.name: Bishkek - Almaty
itineraries.roadConditions: This itinerary has good roads that are well-trafficked excluding the Kazakh side, where we propose an itinerary off of the beaten path. If you’re driving a normal car or a camper van, this can be avoided by taking a shortcut on paved road.

translatedDesc.fr: Cet itinéraire permet de relier les deux grandes villes de Bishkek et d'Almaty en longeant la rive nord du célèbre lac Issyk Kul. En contournant la chaîne de montagne des Kungay Ala-Too, vous découvrirez de l'autre côté de la frontière l'incroyable lac Kaindy ainsi que sa forêt engloutie, et les couleurs extraordinaires du canyon de Charyn.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Visiter la très belle vallée de [Chong-Kemin](::K20).
Camper près du lac [Chon Aksu](::K21).
Vous baigner dans les eaux fraîches et salées d'un des plus grands lacs du monde, Issyk Kul.
S'arrêter pour visiter des [sites archéologiques](::K2:7) de premier plan.
Admirer la forêt engloutie du [lac Kaindy](Lake Kaindy), à la frontière avec le Kazakhstan.
Aller se balader dans le [canyon de Charyn](Charyn Canyon Camp).

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Bonne route goudronnée au Kirghizstan et au Kazakhstan. Le passage par les pistes du Kazakhstan n'est pas adapté aux camping-cars ou aux voitures normales mais peut être évité en restant sur le goudron.

itineraries.description:
This itinerary links the Ferghana plain with the centre of the country and also gives access to Lake Song-Kul, the “blue pearl” of Kyrgyzstan.
You will leave the farm countryside of the Jalalabad region for the arid and dusty badlands of the Naryn valley, before climbing the high altitude edelweiss fields and alpine pastures around Lake Song-Kul.
itineraries.highlights:
A great track over the Kazarman pass, until the tunnel opens.
The famous Song Kul lake.
Saimaluu Tash, one of the best petroglyph sites in Central Asia.
itineraries.name: Kazarman - Song Kul - Naryn
itineraries.roadConditions: The route is only partially paved but in good condition, and can be taken in any type of vehicle (as long as you’re careful). The climb to Song-Köl is steep and rocky, and the descent through the Terskey Torpok pass is equally steep and tight. This itinerary is closed in winter when the passes are snowed in.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire permet de relier la plaine de la Ferghana au centre du pays et d'accéder au lac Son Kul, la « perle bleue » du Kirghizstan.
Vous quitterez les paysages agricoles de la région de Jalalabad pour les badlands arides et poussiéreux de la vallée de la Naryn, avant de monter dans les pâturages et les champs d’edelweiss de haute altitude autour du lac Son Kul.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Une belle piste par le col de Kazarman, pour les amateurs.
Le célèbre lac Song Kul.
Saimaluu Tash, un des plus beaux sites de pétroglyphes d'Asie centrale.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: La piste jusqu'à Kazarman est facile ; la montée vers Song Kul est raide et caillouteuse et la redescente par le col de Terskey Torpok est également raide et étroite. Cet itinéraire est fermé en hiver quand les cols sont enneigés (en attendant l'ouverture du tunnel).

itineraries.description: This short, one-day itinerary is perfect if you need to acclimatize after landing in Leh, or if you have a spare day. It is also a great way to learn about the Buddhist religion in the Indus valley. It takes you to the most famous monasteries - or `i`gompas` as they're called in the Ladakhi (Tibetan) language. It's also a beautiful ride away from the busy streets of Leh, offering great viewpoints for taking pictures.
itineraries.name: Gompas around Leh
itineraries.roadConditions: All roads are paved and in good condition.
itineraries.highlights:
Enjoy the sunrise (or sunset) at the Shanti Stupa.
Thiksey and Hemis monasteries, the most famous in Ladakh.
Visit Stok Palace.
Take in the view from the Stok Buddha.

itineraries.description:
Outside of the Empty Quarter, Wahiba Sands is the most famous erg (dune field) of Oman. It's easily reached from Muscat and offers a wide variety of activities: there are several luxury resorts right into the dunes, tent camps for organized overnight tours and of course a spawling playground for the V8 jeeps that Omanis are fond of. 
If you’re not an expert in soft sand driving or lack a powerful vehicle, don’t worry—there’s an easy route across the dunes suitable for beginners. As long as your vehicle has 4WD, the crossing shouldn’t be a problem. Bikers can also make the journey, but they should have experience with soft sand and rutted tracks, ideally using a lightweight trail or enduro bike. By sticking to the main track and airing down your tires, the likelihood of getting stuck is low. This route serves as an excellent introduction to sand driving before tackling more challenging terrain, such as the Empty Quarter. However, due to the remoteness and sand driving involved, the route is classified as "difficult."
4wd vans and trucks can also follow this route, if they have some experience. There's no GSM reception in the dunes, so you should be self-sufficient. On the plus side, the itinerary sees some light traffic, so in case of trouble you probably will get help within a few hours.
In addition to the thrill of sand driving and the stunning beauty of the dunes, a unique highlight of this journey is a mosque built right in the middle of the dunes, far from any settlement—an unexpected sight.
itineraries.name: Wahiba Sands

translatedDesc.fr:
En dehors de l'"Empty Quarter", Wahiba Sand est l'erg le plus célèbre d'Oman. Comme il est facilement accessible depuis Muscat, il attire les locaux pour un week-end ou quelques jours à jouer dans les dunes avec leur jeep V8 puissantes. On y trouve aussi des hôtels de luxe nichées au cœur des dunes et les agences y organisent des excursions avec nuit sous tente. Mais même si vous n'êtes pas un expert de la conduite dans le sable, et si vous n'avez pas de véhicule très puissant, l'itinéraire proposé est accessible à tous - pour autant que vous ayez un 4x4 bien sûr. Les motards pourront aussi le suivre, mais bien sûr il faudra être habitué à rouler dans le sable mou et les ornières, donc c'est plutôt réservé aux trails légers et aux enduros. Quant aux vans et aux camions, 4x4 ou 6x6 bien sûr, tant qu'ils restent sur les traces ils ne devraient pas avoir trop de problème. C'est en tous cas une excellente initiation à la conduite dans le sable si vous êtes un débutant.
Bien sûr, il n'y a plus de réception GSM dans les dunes, donc il vous faudra être en autonomie complète. Mais d'un autre côté, comme c'est un itinéraire bien connu, en cas de coup dur vous ne devriez pas attendre très longtemps sans voir passer quelques voitures qui pourraient vous aider. 
A part le simple plaisir de rouler dans un paysage majestueux, l'itinéraire comporte une curiosité inattendue: une mosquée construite au beau milieu des dunes, loin de toute habitation.

itineraries.highlights:
Razang La monument.
Beautiful and uncrowded roads.
itineraries.description:
This route is rarely used because it bypasses Pangong Tso, one of the main destinations for most tourists. Still, it's a convenient and beautiful drive on good roads. The alternative is to take the [road to Pangong Tso](::L10) and rejoin this route at Chushul.
From Chushul, this route follows the Indus valley, so there's no high pass to cross (Tsaga La, {^4640}). Although the roads are not in great condition, this option may be easier in bad weather than the alternative via [Kaksang La](Kaksang La) ({^5430}). From the end point at Loma you can then continue toward [Hanle](::L12) or return to Leh.
itineraries.name: Tangtse - Tsaga La
itineraries.roadConditions: From Tangtse to Chushul, the road is paved and in good condition. Between Chushul and Loma, the road is only partially paved but not particularly difficult. Tourist mini-vans routinely use this road.

itineraries.description:
On this route you will discover a remote and spectacular mountain range. Indeed, some of the deep canyons can only be visited on foot or with a small motorcycle.  The route passes through an old phosphate mine and near coal mines operated by Chinese firms.
You can fuel up and buy food and water in Sevrei, Noyon and Gurvantes.
itineraries.highlights:
Moon-like landscapes and extraordinary [geological formations](?Gobi Folds).
Drink a cup of tea with the nomads who inhabit this massif and who seldom receive visits from foreigners.
itineraries.name: Canyons in the Gobi
itineraries.roadConditions: The tracks are in quite good condition, although somewhat bumpy along the riverbeds. Of course, you'll have to get through a short patch of soft sand in the pass between the Khongyn Els dunes, so 4WD is strongly recommended.

translatedDesc.fr:
Cet itinéraire vous permet de découvrir les recoins d’un massif spectaculaire et très original. Vous parcourrez de profonds canyons, certains ne se visitant qu'à pied ou avec une petite moto. 
L'itinéraire passe par une ancienne exploitation de phosphate et à proximité de mines de charbon exploitées par les Chinois.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Explorer des [formations géologiques](?Gobi Folds) remarquables.
Boire une tasse de thé avec les nomades qui habitent ce massif et qui ne reçoivent que peu de visites d'étrangers.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Les pistes sont assez bonnes dans l’ensemble, même si elles peuvent être un peu cassantes lorsqu’elles suivent le lit des rivières.

itineraries.highlights: Excellent viewpoints on Tso Moriri all along the lake.
itineraries.roadConditions: Paved road under construction.
itineraries.description: By the time you read this, the situation may have changed, as the new route from Ladakh to Spiti is still under construction (work began in 2024). There used to be a small but beautiful gravel track along the western shore of Tso Moriri, offering access to excellent camping spots. It also allowed for a loop around the southern end of Tso Moriri and back along the eastern shore—a [route](::L31) you can still take today. However, the stretch along the western shore has now been replaced by tarmac. Eventually, the road will connect to [Kiato](::L20:4) in Spiti via [Takling La](Takling La).
itineraries.name: Tsomoriri - Spiti

itineraries.description: This itinerary is a variant of the Northern route which links Olgii to Ulaangon. It passes near two splendid lakes: Lake Achit with its orange and pink rocks in the setting sun, and Lake Üüreg surrounded by mountains.
itineraries.highlights:
Great camping on the banks of the lakes.
Archaeological remains from the Bronze Age.
itineraries.name: Achit and Üüreg Lakes
itineraries.roadConditions: The itinerary passes near a coal mine and crosses a high mountain-pass at {^2535}. The tracks are in good condition, and you won’t encounter any major difficulty.

translatedDesc.fr: Cet itinéraire est une variante de la route Nord qui relie Olgii à Ulaangom. Il passe à proximité de  deux lacs splendides : les lacs Achit et Üüreg. L'itinéraire passe à proximité d'une mine de charbon et franchit un haut col à {^2535} d'altitude.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Deux lacs splendides : le lac Achit et ses rochers rose-orangé à voir au soleil couchant, et le lac Üüreg entouré de montagnes.
Bivouaquer près des lacs et se baigner dans l'Üüreg Nuur.
Vestiges archéologiques de l’âge du Bronze.

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Les pistes sont correctes (sauf pour les véhicules à faible garde au sol), vous ne rencontrerez pas de difficulté majeure.

itineraries.description: Rarely visited by tourists and very sparsely populated, this valley has authentic villages, magnificent jailoos, fast-flowing rivers, and wonderful, off the beaten path adventures. Characterised by a relatively humid climate and lush pastures, the Suusamyr valley was an important, high-altitude grassland for raising sheep during Soviet times. Today, the land is used for other agricultural purposes, including beekeeping, vegetable, and potato farming.
itineraries.highlights:
A little used but spectacular road to reach Song Kul, mostly unpaved.
Very photogenic red rocks near Kyzyl Oy.
itineraries.name: Suusamyr Valley
itineraries.roadConditions: The going is good on these roads, though the climb to Lake Song Kul is only possible after the snow melts, between June and September.

translatedDesc.fr: Peu visitée par les touristes et avec une densité de population extrêmement faible, la vallée offre des villages authentiques, de magnifiques jailoos, des rivières tumultueuses et de belles aventures hors des sentiers battus. Avec un climat relativement humide et des pâturages gras, la vallée de Suusamyr était un centre important de transhumance et un haut lieu d’élevage de moutons à l'époque soviétique. L'utilisation des terres est plus diversifiée aujourd’hui (culture de pommes de terre, de légumes, production de miel). Le tourisme, n’en est encore qu’à ses balbutiements, profitez-en avant qu’il ne soit trop tard.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Une route très peu utilisée mais spectaculaire pour atteindre Song Kul.
Les magnifiques roches rouges photogéniques près de Kyzyl Oy.
Une alternative offroad à la route principale Bishkek-Osh, en echaînant avec le [col de Kirk-Kiz](::K22).

translatedRoadConditions.fr: Bonnes pistes roulantes. La montée au lac Son Kul n’est praticable qu’après la fonte des neiges, entre fin juin et septembre.

itineraries.description:
The major attraction of the Fann mountains is a valley with 7 consecutive lakes called "Haft kul", where `i`haft` means seven in tajik (persian) and `i`kul` means lake. 
Many fantastic treks start or finish here, such as the multi-day hikes to [Iskanderkul](Iskanderkul lake barrier) and the [Alauddin Lakes](Vertical Alauddin).
Note that Haft Kul is a very popular destination for Tajiks, so you may find it crowded—especially on the beaches.
There are several places where one can camp, but of course you may have company (locals or others) for the night.
itineraries.highlights:
Amazing alpine vistas anywhere along this road.
Great trekking destinations from there.
itineraries.name: Haft Kul
itineraries.roadConditions:
You can drive up to the [7th lake](:::6) and camp there, but the road becomes more difficult after [Marghuzor](:::5) (6th lake). Still, it is accessible to most vehicles with good ground clearance; 4WD is not necessary.
Big rigs can drive up to the 3rd lake, further up it's too narrow.

translatedDesc.fr:
La principale attraction des montagnes du Fann est une vallée avec 7 lacs consécutifs appelée "Haft Kul", où haft signifie sept en tadjik (persan) et kul signifie lac.
De nombreuses randonnées magnifiques commencent ou se terminent ici, comme les treks de plusieurs jours vers [Iskanderkul](Iskanderkul lake barrier) et les [lacs Alauddin](Vertical Alauddin).
Il y a plusieurs endroits où l’on peut camper, mais comme Haft Kul est une destination très populaire auprès de Tadjiks, il se peut que vous ne soyiez pas seuls, notamment sur les plages.

translatedHighlights.fr:
Des paysages alipns époustouflants.
Des itinéraires pédestres magnifiques.

translatedRoadConditions.fr:
Vous pouvez monter en voiture jusqu'au [7ᵉ lac](:::6) et y camper, mais la route devient plus difficile après [Marghuzor](:::5) (6ᵉ lake). Malgré tout, cela reste accessible aux véhicules légers avec une garde au sol raisonnable, même sans 4x4.
Les camions et camping-cars s'arrêteront au 3ᵉ lac, ensuite la route devient trop étroite.
